original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa na /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa na /
translated: In order to clarify this, he says:

original: sdud pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdud pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” means “if it were so.”

original: rang ngam zhes bya ba ni don byed par snang ba bzhin du rang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: rang ngam zhes bya ba ni don byed par snang ba bzhin du rang gi ngo bos so //
translated: “By itself” means by its own nature, as it appears to perform a function.

original: gzhan gyis ni zhes bya bas ni sgrub par byed pa snang ba bzhin du don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni zhes bya bas ni sgrub par byed pa snang ba bzhin du don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “By another” means by the nature of another cognition, which appears to establish it, as it appears to perform a function.

original: gal te re zhig rmi lam dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba bden par yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te re zhig rmi lam dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba bden par yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If, in a dream, the distinction between the two is not real,

original: gnod pa med par ni der mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med par ni der mi 'byung ste /
translated: then it is not so in the waking state, because it is not contradicted.

original: rmi lam na yang don byed par snang ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang don byed par snang ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For one sees things performing functions even in a dream.

original: des na rmi lam dang cig shos kyi tshad ma @211b dang gzhan pa'i rnam par bzhag pa yang gnod pas byas pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: des na rmi lam dang cig shos kyi tshad ma @211b dang gzhan pa'i rnam par bzhag pa yang gnod pas byas pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the distinction between valid cognitions in a dream and in the waking state is also made on the basis of contradiction.

original: de nyid du na ni /
analyzed: de nyid du na ni /
translated: In response to this, he says:

original: rmi lam mi min khyad med ces smos so //
analyzed: rmi lam mi min khyad med ces smos so //
translated: “In a dream, there is no difference between a man and a post.”

original: rmi lam dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: “In a dream” is an explanatory term.

original: 'o na tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni de kho na nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni de kho na nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the distinction between valid cognition and other states of consciousness is real,

original: de bzhin du zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes smos so //
translated: then the response is “just so.”

original: 'di gnyi ga tha snyad tsam du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga tha snyad tsam du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can both of these be mere conventions?

original: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes smos te /
translated: The response is “will be explained.”

original: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'i nang 'dir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'i nang 'dir ro //
translated: This will be explained in the chapter on conventional truth.

original: ji skad du rmi lam na yang don byed par snang ba yod do zhes brjod pa der yang don byed par snang ba tsam gyis ni tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: ji skad du rmi lam na yang don byed par snang ba yod do zhes brjod pa der yang don byed par snang ba tsam gyis ni tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: Just as it is said that even in a dream there is the appearance of objects that perform functions, so too, if mere appearance performing a function were valid knowledge,🔽then the definition of valid knowledge would be too broad.

original: gang gi mtshan nyid ha cang khyab pa'i skyon du 'gyur 'on kyang don byed par gnas par mi 'gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni mi slu ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi mtshan nyid ha cang khyab pa'i skyon du 'gyur 'on kyang don byed par gnas par mi 'gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni mi slu ba yin la /
translated: But unreliability is the nature of that which does not endure in a way that performs a function.

original: de yang tshad ma yin no snyam du zhe la bzhag 'di ni smras so //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma yin no snyam du zhe la bzhag 'di ni smras so //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement “But that which is undeceiving is valid knowledge.”

original: gal te gnyi ga la yang don byed pa ring du gnas pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga la yang don byed pa ring du gnas pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if both are not enduring in a way that performs a function,🔽then how can they be valid cognitions?

original: mod la 'gyur ba ni res 'ga' sad pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ci ltar mi g-yo ba dang cig shos rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: mod la 'gyur ba ni res 'ga' sad pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ci ltar mi g-yo ba dang cig shos rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Since it is sometimes the case that one awakens from sleep, how can one posit the difference between the unmoving and the other?

original: bden te zhib mor brtags na rmi lam dang cig shos dag khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes brjod zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bden te zhib mor brtags na rmi lam dang cig shos dag khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes brjod zin pa nyid do //
translated: It is true, but if one examines carefully, there is not the slightest difference between a dream and the other.

original: dper na sad pa'i gnas skabs na phyi rol du sgro 'dogs pa dang / nyi ma de 'das te mtshan mo la sogs pas bar du chod kyang don byed par snang ba nyams su myong ba la dran pa yod pa na bden par sgro 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: dper na sad pa'i gnas skabs na phyi rol du sgro 'dogs pa dang / nyi ma de 'das te mtshan mo la sogs pas bar du chod kyang don byed par snang ba nyams su myong ba la dran pa yod pa na bden par sgro 'dogs pa dang /
translated: For example, in the waking state, one imputes external objects, and even after the sun has set, one experiences the appearance of objects that are obstructed by night, etc., and when memory exists, one imputes true existence.

original: des byas pa'i phan pa rim gyis zad pas cung zad rjes su 'jug par rlom pa de bzhin du rmi lam du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des byas pa'i phan pa rim gyis zad pas cung zad rjes su 'jug par rlom pa de bzhin du rmi lam du ni ma yin te /
translated: And just as one imagines that the benefit produced by that is gradually exhausted, so it is not in a dream.

original: de'i sgro 'dogs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i sgro 'dogs pa ni /
translated: The imputation of that

original: gnyid kyi cha'i mthar thug pa'i yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid kyi cha'i mthar thug pa'i yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is due to the final stage of sleep.🔽The stability and instability of the performance of the function

original: des don byed pa brtan pa dang mi brtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des don byed pa brtan pa dang mi brtan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is due to the strength or weakness of the cause.

original: sgro 'dogs brtan pa dang mi brtan pa yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs brtan pa dang mi brtan pa yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the superimposition is either stable or unstable.🔽This is what is being taught:

original: de nyid ston pa ni rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In a dream, etc.”

original: don byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Causing an effect” means

original: don byed par snang ba'o //
analyzed: don byed par snang ba'o //
translated: appearing to cause an effect.

original: goms pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags so //
analyzed: goms pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags so //
translated: “Habituation” means latent potentialities.

original: don byed par snang ba 'di ni goms pa'i stobs las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: don byed par snang ba 'di ni goms pa'i stobs las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: This appearance of causing an effect arises from the power of habituation,🔽but it is not produced by a real thing.

original: bden pas byas pa ni ma yin no zhes nges pa'i phyir na ;🔽tshim pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pas byas pa ni ma yin no zhes nges pa'i phyir na ; tshim pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore,🔽since there is no satisfaction,🔽there is no complete satisfaction.

original: sad pas ni bzlog pa'i phyir na yongs su tshim pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sad pas ni bzlog pa'i phyir na yongs su tshim pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what it means.

original: 'dis ni bag chags brtan pa dang mi brtan pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bag chags brtan pa dang mi brtan pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the superimposition is either stable or unstable.

original: de'i phyir mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa med pas na ha cang khyab par mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa med pas na ha cang khyab par mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no error in the definition of nondeception, there is no overextension.

original: kun rdzob @212a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob @212a * //
translated: The conventional

original: la brten pa'i phyir mi srid pa'i go skabs med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: la brten pa'i phyir mi srid pa'i go skabs med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is absolutely impossible for it to be non-existent.

original: don byed par snang bas ma khyab pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod zin pas /
analyzed: don byed par snang bas ma khyab pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod zin pas /
translated: And it is not the case that it is not pervaded by the appearance of the object's function, as has already been explained.

original: ma khyab pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi slu bas kyang mi slu ba zhes 'dis gang brjod pa de yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma khyab pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi slu bas kyang mi slu ba zhes 'dis gang brjod pa de yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: So, in order to demonstrate that it is not pervaded, the statement, It is not deceptive because it is non-deceptive is also refuted.

original: 'di ni gzhan nyid la skyon yin no zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan nyid la skyon yin no zhes smras pa ni /
translated: The statement, This is a fault in the case of difference,

original: gnod pa med pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: is the same as saying, If it is non-deceptive,

original: thug pa med pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thug pa med pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: there is an infinite regress.

original: 'di la shes pa skyes pa nyid na gnod pa med pa mtshan nyid du brjod dam /
analyzed: 'di la shes pa skyes pa nyid na gnod pa med pa mtshan nyid du brjod dam /
translated: In this case, is non-deceptiveness said to be the characteristic of the cognition itself when it arises,

original: dus gzhan du zhes rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //🔽tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe nyid don byed pa yang thob pa'i phyir mi 'jug par thal ba so na 'dug go //
analyzed: dus gzhan du zhes rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro // tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe nyid don byed pa yang thob pa'i phyir mi 'jug par thal ba so na 'dug go //
translated: or at another time? Because of the different considerations.🔽If it is not different, then at that very time, since the object's function is also obtained, the consequence of non-engagement remains.

original: tha dad pa yin na de'i bya ba sgrub pa'i rang bzhin la 'dis ma reg pa'i phyir gang la mi slu /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na de'i bya ba sgrub pa'i rang bzhin la 'dis ma reg pa'i phyir gang la mi slu /
translated: If it is different, then since it does not touch the nature of accomplishing its function, what is it non-deceptive about?

original: chu mthong ba la ni me thob pa mi slu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chu mthong ba la ni me thob pa mi slu ba ma yin no //
translated: But the perception of water is not a nondeceptive means of valid cognition with regard to the obtaining of fire.

original: gal te rang ngam gzhan gyi don byed pas byas pa mi slu ba ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te rang ngam gzhan gyi don byed pas byas pa mi slu ba ma yin mod /
translated: If you say that it is not nondeceptive with regard to the object to be accomplished, whether it is one’s own or another’s,

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam nyid de tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa tsam nyid de tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it is just the mere awareness of its own nature that is a means of valid cognition.

original: de'i rang bzhin rig pa tsam de ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rig pa tsam de ni zhes smos so //
translated: The response to that is, “That mere awareness of its nature . . .”

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa la snang ba ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa la snang ba ste /
translated: “ Its” refers to what appears to the consciousness.

original: phyi rol lam brdzun pa'am /
analyzed: phyi rol lam brdzun pa'am /
translated: It is either external or false,

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: or it is the nature of the consciousness itself.

original: de'i sgra med na ni rang bzhin zhes bya bas dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sgra med na ni rang bzhin zhes bya bas dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word “its” were omitted, one would understand that the nature of the thing is apprehended.

original: gal te rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid ni tshad mar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid ni tshad mar mi 'dod do //
translated: But if the mere apprehension of its own nature is not accepted as a means of valid cognition,

original: de ci ltar shes pa thams cad la mtshungs she na /
analyzed: de ci ltar shes pa thams cad la mtshungs she na /
translated: then how is it that it is the same for all consciousnesses?

original: 'o na dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid ni don byed pa la mi slu ba nyid las yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba spangs pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin rig pa nyid gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid ni don byed pa la mi slu ba nyid las yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba spangs pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin rig pa nyid gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: Well then, since the nature of things is due to the nondeceptiveness of the performance of function, the nature of appearance, which is the abandonment of deceptiveness, would be cognition itself.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin rig pa yang thun mong yin pa'i phyir na don bya ba don du gnyer ba rnam par phye nas 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin rig pa yang thun mong yin pa'i phyir na don bya ba don du gnyer ba rnam par phye nas 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: And since the nature of appearance, which is cognition, is common, it is not tenable that one engages in and turns away from the performance of function by distinguishing it.

original: tha snyad pa rnams tshad mas 'jug pa'i gtam yang ga na yod /
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams tshad mas 'jug pa'i gtam yang ga na yod /
translated: So how could there be any talk of conventional valid knowledge engaging in objects?

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa ni de kho na nyid kyi tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir tha snyad pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa ni de kho na nyid kyi tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir tha snyad pa smos so //
translated: Since the nature of things would be valid knowledge of reality, it is called “conventional.”

original: de lta na don la mi slu ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa'i tshad mar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na don la mi slu ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa'i tshad mar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how could it be valid knowledge that is reflexive awareness in terms of being nondeceptive with respect to its object?

original: de lta ma yin te don yongs su bcad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te don yongs su bcad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa ni /
translated: It is not like that. The performance of function, which is characterized by the ascertainment of the object,

original: de'i rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba yin pas skyes pa'i dus nyid la gsal ba dang 'di mthong ngo zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba yin pas skyes pa'i dus nyid la gsal ba dang 'di mthong ngo zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Since it is the nature of that, it is clear at the time of arising, and the convention “I see this” is made. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: de ltar mi slu ba tshol ba na phyi ma'i don byed pa la ltos pa nyid mi slu bar rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar mi slu ba tshol ba na phyi ma'i don byed pa la ltos pa nyid mi slu bar rigs so //
translated: Thus, when seeking nondeceptiveness, it is reasonable that nondeceptiveness depends on the performance of a function in the future.

original: des na de kho na nyid do zhes bstan pa ma @212b yin no //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid do zhes bstan pa ma @212b yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not taught that that is the way things really are.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa lus pa na /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa lus pa na /
translated: Thus, when the second conception remains,

original: tshad ma'i tshul ci 'dra bar gnas pa de ston pa ni de'i phyir 'byung 'gyur don yul dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i tshul ci 'dra bar gnas pa de ston pa ni de'i phyir 'byung 'gyur don yul dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the way in which valid knowledge exists is taught. Therefore, it is said, “The arising of the object of engagement.”

original: gang gi phyir de kho nar tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir tha snyad rjes su 'jug par byed pa ni skyod par byed pa ste ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho nar tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir tha snyad rjes su 'jug par byed pa ni skyod par byed pa ste ;
translated: Since the reason is that the distinction between valid knowledge and invalid knowledge does not exist in reality, therefore, the one who engages in conventions is the one who moves,

original: tha snyad la rten par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad la rten par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, the one who relies on conventions.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: da ltar ba'i yul la zhugs kyang thob par bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can dang / gzugs la zhugs kyang reg bya la sogs pa spyod yul du byed pa can te /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i yul la zhugs kyang thob par bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can dang / gzugs la zhugs kyang reg bya la sogs pa spyod yul du byed pa can te /
translated: Even though it engages a present object, it is a subject that has an object that will occur, and even though it engages form, it takes tactile objects and so on as its domain.

original: gang zhig de ltar gyur pa de ni tha snyad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar gyur pa de ni tha snyad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is like that is conventional.

original: yang na tha snyad pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na tha snyad pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or it means that which is conventional is like this.

original: yang ji ltar gzhan yul du gyur pa na yul gzhan rnam par 'jog ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gzhan yul du gyur pa na yul gzhan rnam par 'jog ce na /
translated: Moreover, how can one posit another object when the object is different?

original: lhag par sgro btags pas zhes smos te /
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pas zhes smos te /
translated: He says, “due to superimposition,”

original: gcig tu sgro btags pas so //
analyzed: gcig tu sgro btags pas so //
translated: due to the superimposition of singularity.

original: gal te tha snyad la lhag par sgro 'dogs par srid kyang de la ltos pa nyid kyis tshad mar rnam par gzhag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad la lhag par sgro 'dogs par srid kyang de la ltos pa nyid kyis tshad mar rnam par gzhag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Even though it is possible to superimpose conventionalities, what is the point of positing valid knowledge in dependence on that?

original: mthong bzhin pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mthong bzhin pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would be just as if one were seeing.

original: bshad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang yul gzhan de dag thob pa don du gnyer ba dang / de dag gi don bya ba don du gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang yul gzhan de dag thob pa don du gnyer ba dang / de dag gi don bya ba don du gnyer ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the words “that which is to be attained” and “another object” is the same as the meaning of the words “that which is to be attained in the future” and “the object of the activity of attainment.”

original: tha dad pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par bstan to //
translated: They are taught to be non-different.

original: gal te mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid phyis don byed pa yin ba des 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang / gcig pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid phyis don byed pa yin ba des 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang / gcig pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If that which is seen is the very same thing that performs the activity of the object in the future, is it not reasonable to say that they are the same?

original: yul gzhan dang go ji ltar gcig par rigs she na /
analyzed: yul gzhan dang go ji ltar gcig par rigs she na /
translated: How can it be reasonable to say that they are the same when they are different objects?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: He says “just as” and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i nang du mi 'du'o zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i nang du mi 'du'o zhes 'brel to //
translated: In the same way, the nature of that which is to be attained in the future is not included in the nature of form and so on that is being apprehended.

original: 'o na ji ltar gang du 'dus she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gang du 'dus she na /
translated: Well then, how is it included?

original: lhag par sgro btags pas ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pas ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says “by the superimposition of identity.”

original: de gcig nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de gcig nyid yin pa zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang gcig pa nyid do //
translated: “That very thing” is the very same thing as the nature of form and so on that is appearing.

original: yul gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba ni reg bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gcig yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: yul gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba ni reg bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gcig yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: And the object is also different. The meaning is that the characteristics of tactile objects, etc. are also the same.

original: yang gi sgros ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgros ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yang ngo //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the nature of the elements is also the same.

analyzed: dngul ma yin no snyam pa'i shes pa gnyis yin la /

analyzed: mthar thug pa ga la yod do //

analyzed: gang zhig gnod byed ma skyes kyang //

analyzed: rmongs pa yis ni rtog byed pa // de ni tha snyad thams cad la //

original: de'i tshe don bya ba don du gnyer bas tshad ma 'tshol la de tshol ba'i byed pa ni don byed pa sgrub pa nges pa nyid na rdzogs par gyur pas thug pa med pa ldag pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe don bya ba don du gnyer bas tshad ma 'tshol la de tshol ba'i byed pa ni don byed pa sgrub pa nges pa nyid na rdzogs par gyur pas thug pa med pa ldag pa yin mod kyi /
translated: At that time, one who is intent on accomplishing a purpose seeks a valid cognition, and the activity of seeking it is completed only when one has ascertained the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: 'on kyang de lta yin na mi slu ba tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta yin na mi slu ba tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //

original: yang na gnod pa med pa yin na /🔽tshad ma nyid mi gnas pa nyid do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gnod pa med pa yin na / tshad ma nyid mi gnas pa nyid do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Or, if it is nondeceptive,🔽then valid cognition would not exist.

original: tshad ma nyid rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to /
