original: skye ba'i dus na gnod pa med pa ni thams cad la yod pas na ha cang khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i dus na gnod pa med pa ni thams cad la yod pas na ha cang khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since all things exist at the time of their production, it is too broad.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod byed med par nges pa ni mi srid pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod byed med par nges pa ni mi srid pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The definition of valid knowledge is not ascertained as the absence of a future object of refutation because it is impossible that it not exist.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no valid knowledge that perceives the future.

original: ma nges pa yang mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Also, it is not the definition of valid knowledge that it is nondeceptive.

original: goms pa las sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nges na ni snga ma bzhin don bya ba nges pa drangs pa yin no //
analyzed: goms pa las sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nges na ni snga ma bzhin don bya ba nges pa drangs pa yin no //
translated: If one ascertains the nature of the establishment through habituation, then, as before, one draws the ascertainment of the object.

original: des na gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa ni don dam pa'am kun rdzob tu yang mtshan nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa ni don dam pa'am kun rdzob tu yang mtshan nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the non-defective cognition is not a characteristic either ultimately or conventionally.

original: mi slu ba can gyi kun rdzob kho nar mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: mi slu ba can gyi kun rdzob kho nar mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: It is a characteristic only conventionally, and it is not deceptive.

original: mtshan nyid kyi skyon 'ga' yang med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi skyon 'ga' yang med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: It is established that there is no fault of the characteristic.🔽Now, someone argues that the cognition of yellow in a conch is too pervasive.

original: gang yang dung la ser por shes pas ha cang khyab pa rtsod pa de la smra ba ni ;
analyzed: gang yang dung la ser por shes pas ha cang khyab pa rtsod pa de la smra ba ni ;
translated: The response to that is:

original: dung ser por zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dung ser por zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The cognition of yellow in a conch.”

original: 'di la tshad ma mi srid pa ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma mi srid pa ga las yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that a valid cognition is impossible in this case?

original: de lta zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de lta zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The response is:

original: dung ser po'i rnam pas bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dung ser po'i rnam pas bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because there is no attainment of the object to be established by the aspect of yellow in a conch.”

original: dung tsam la mi slu ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: dung tsam la mi slu ba yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is non-deceptiveness in just the conch,

original: mthong bzhin pa'i ser po'i rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i dung ni snang ba med do //
analyzed: mthong bzhin pa'i ser po'i rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i dung ni snang ba med do //
translated: The conch is not perceived apart from the aspect of yellow that is seen.

original: dbyibs tsam snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs tsam snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the shape alone is perceived,

original: dbyibs kyang ser po'i rnam pa las ma gtogs par ni snang ba med do //
analyzed: dbyibs kyang ser po'i rnam pa las ma gtogs par ni snang ba med do //
translated: then the shape is not perceived apart from the aspect of yellow.

original: ser po'i rnam pa la yang bslus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ser po'i rnam pa la yang bslus pa'i phyir /
translated: And because the aspect of yellow is deceptive,

original: gzhan gang du mi slu ba yod //
analyzed: gzhan gang du mi slu ba yod //
translated: where else is there anything that is not deceptive?

original: des na mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: slu ba med pa'i don 'khrul pa med par bya ba'i dbyibs tsam la ni tshad ma gzhan mi bzlogs so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i don 'khrul pa med par bya ba'i dbyibs tsam la ni tshad ma gzhan mi bzlogs so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The shape alone, which is the object that is not deceptive, is not refuted by another valid cognition that is not mistaken.

original: dbyibs tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbyibs tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is taught by “the shape alone.”

original: grub pa ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni thob pa'o //
translated: “Established” means “attained.”

original: rjes su dpag pa de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The inference itself is taught by “in this way.”

original: snang ba ni dung dang dkar po ltar rab rib can la don gyis na 'bras bu'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: snang ba ni dung dang dkar po ltar rab rib can la don gyis na 'bras bu'i rtags yin no //
translated: The appearance, like the conch and the white, is the effect of the eye disease, which is the reason.

original: de la yang kha dog ser po med kyang /
analyzed: de la yang kha dog ser po med kyang /
translated: Even though there is no yellow color there,

original: dbyibs kyis bsgrub bya chu 'dzin @214a * //
analyzed: dbyibs kyis bsgrub bya chu 'dzin @214a * //
translated: the shape establishes the object, water,

original: pa la sogs pa'i don byed par grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i don byed par grub pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is established that it performs the function of a conch, etc.

original: de 'dra ba'i snang ba dbyibs tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyi bdag po'i rkyen dang 'brel par grub po //🔽des ni de la rjes su dpag pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i snang ba dbyibs tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyi bdag po'i rkyen dang 'brel par grub po // des ni de la rjes su dpag pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, the connection of such an appearance with the dominant condition characterized by mere shape is established.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “by which” indicates that the inference is in regard to that, and not in regard to anything else.

original: dung dkar po ma mthong ma thos pa'i mig ser can gang gis ser por snang ba dung ser po med par 'khrul pa nam yang ma mthong gi /
analyzed: dung dkar po ma mthong ma thos pa'i mig ser can gang gis ser por snang ba dung ser po med par 'khrul pa nam yang ma mthong gi /
translated: The person who has jaundice, who has not seen or heard of a white conch, and who perceives a yellow conch, never sees the non-existence of the yellow conch.

original: 'on kyang dung ser por snang ba na 'di 'dra ba'i dung nyid yod par 'gyur ro snyam par rlom pa'i rtogs pa po de ni slu ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dung ser por snang ba na 'di 'dra ba'i dung nyid yod par 'gyur ro snyam par rlom pa'i rtogs pa po de ni slu ba kho na'o //
translated: However, when the conch appears yellow, the conceiver who thinks “such a conch exists” is deceived.

original: gang du slu zhe na /
analyzed: gang du slu zhe na /
translated: Where is he deceived?

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dung ser po la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dung ser po la'o //
translated: In the yellow conch as desired.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: ji ltar bsam pa'i dung ser po la bslus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam pa'i dung ser po la bslus pa'i phyir te /
translated: From the yellow conch as imagined, because of the deception.

original: mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of seeing.

original: snga ma la ni rtogs pa 'di med do zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma la ni rtogs pa 'di med do zhes smras pa ni /
translated: The former does not have this understanding.

original: 'khrul pa rig pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa rig pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is called “the awareness of error.”

original: de'i dpyad pa nyid brjod pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dpyad pa nyid brjod pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The analysis of that is stated: “in regard to another.”

original: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa bstan to //
translated: This shows inference.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In regard to another”

original: ser po'i rang bzhin la ste /
analyzed: ser po'i rang bzhin la ste /
translated: means in regard to the nature of yellow.

original: gser du gtogs pa'i ser po yang yod pa'i phyir na ser po'am dkar po zhes the tshom za'o //
analyzed: gser du gtogs pa'i ser po yang yod pa'i phyir na ser po'am dkar po zhes the tshom za'o //
translated: Since there is also yellow that belongs to gold, there is doubt as to whether it is yellow or white.

original: bzlog par gyur pa yin yang rung skye zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rab rib kyi skyon nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bzlog par gyur pa yin yang rung skye zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rab rib kyi skyon nyid yin gyi /
translated: Even if there is a reversal, it arises. This is the fault of blurred vision.

original: dung gi dkar po nyid do zhes the tshom las zlog pa nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dung gi dkar po nyid do zhes the tshom las zlog pa nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: It is the whiteness of the conch. From doubt, there is a reversal and certainty,

original: rigs pa 'ga' zhig gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa 'ga' zhig gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by some reasoning.

original: 'on kyang rigs pa de rnam pa thams cad du phyin ci log gi dogs pa bsal bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs pa de rnam pa thams cad du phyin ci log gi dogs pa bsal bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: However, since that reasoning does not completely eliminate doubt,

original: the tshom gyi bye brag nyid do //
analyzed: the tshom gyi bye brag nyid do //
translated: it is just a particular kind of doubt.

original: de lta ma yin na dbyibs rjes su dpag pa'i don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbyibs rjes su dpag pa'i don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, the shape would be pointless to infer,

original: dung dkar por grub pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dung dkar por grub pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by the mere establishment of the white conch.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug sdud par rjes su dpag pa dang / the tshom nyid brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug sdud par rjes su dpag pa dang / the tshom nyid brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in the conclusion, he states the doubt itself and the inference.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la zhes bya ba der spro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la zhes bya ba der spro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, and so on is to be expanded to in the light of the jewel lamp.

original: gal te gnyi ga yang rnag gi rang bzhin rig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir /🔽gcig tshad ma yin la gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs zhes bsams nas rtsod pa byed pa ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga yang rnag gi rang bzhin rig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir / gcig tshad ma yin la gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs zhes bsams nas rtsod pa byed pa ni /
translated: If both are of the nature of pus, and have the nature of cognition,🔽how can one be valid knowledge and the other not valid knowledge?

original: ci ste zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Thinking this, the opponent raises an objection,🔽saying, If it is argued that...

original: len du 'di yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: len du 'di yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here also, it is said that...

original: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces bya ba 'dir ro //
translated: Validity is from convention.

original: gal te snang ba'i ser po thob pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te snang ba'i ser po thob pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the yellow appearance does not obtain the object,

original: dung ser por shes pa chad ma ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dung ser por shes pa chad ma ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the cognition of a yellow conch is not non-erroneous?

original: de bzhin du @214b sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la yang thob par bya ba 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du @214b sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la yang thob par bya ba 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, in the case of a cognition arising from a word, there is nothing to be attained.

original: de yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, that [cognition] is not a valid cognition, one might suspect.

original: btab zin pa nyid kyi lan dran pa byed pa ni sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: btab zin pa nyid kyi lan dran pa byed pa ni sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [Dharmakīrti] recalls the response that was already given: The cognition that has a word as its object...

original: gal te sngar slu ba med pa can nyid tshad mar brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sngar slu ba med pa can nyid tshad mar brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If non-deceptiveness is not stated as the definition of valid cognition,

original: de lta go mngon par 'dod pa ston pa nyid ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de lta go mngon par 'dod pa ston pa nyid ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: then how is the very teaching of what is manifestly intended stated?

original: mngon par bsams pa'i don zhes smos so //
analyzed: mngon par bsams pa'i don zhes smos so //
translated: [Dharmakīrti] says, the teaching of the intended meaning.

original: 'dis ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don ston par byed pa nyid ni mi slu ba las gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don ston par byed pa nyid ni mi slu ba las gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: This [verse] states that the very teaching of the intended meaning is nothing other than non-deceptiveness,

original: 'on kyang mi slu ba nyid do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi slu ba nyid do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: but rather it is non-deceptiveness itself.

original: 'di nyid sdud pa ni gzhal bya'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid sdud pa ni gzhal bya'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This very [definition] is summarized in the line beginning with the nature of the object of cognition...

original: deng ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: deng ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Now [means]

original: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: The nature of the object to be evaluated.

original: gal te slu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa nyid 'dir mngon par 'dod pa dang / rdzogs pa thob pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te slu ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa nyid 'dir mngon par 'dod pa dang / rdzogs pa thob pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if you do admit that the nature of nondeception, etc. is known here, and that perfection is attained,

original: de lta na yang mi slu ba nyid ni thams cad du don byed pa tha dad pa yin par gzhan du dmigs so zhes brgal zhing brtag pa na khyod kyis lan cung zad gdab dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi slu ba nyid ni thams cad du don byed pa tha dad pa yin par gzhan du dmigs so zhes brgal zhing brtag pa na khyod kyis lan cung zad gdab dgos so zhe na /
translated: still, when we argue and investigate, saying that nondeception is a different object that performs a different function, you must give some answer.

original: gal te gzhan gyis mi slu bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i zhen pa 'di /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis mi slu bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i zhen pa 'di /
translated: If you think that this attachment to nondeception🔽is in reality or conventionally,

original: de kho na'am tha snyad du yin phyogs dang po brjod pa ni 'dir rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na'am tha snyad du yin phyogs dang po brjod pa ni 'dir rang gi ngo bor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the first position is stated here: “in its own nature.”

original: aartha kre ya dza te zhes bya ba ni don byed pa grub pa'am don byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: aartha kre ya dza te zhes bya ba ni don byed pa grub pa'am don byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Artha-kriya-jñāna means the establishment of the performance of a function or the form of the performance of a function.

original: gal te de'i don byed pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni 'dir log par rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: gal te de'i don byed pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni 'dir log par rtogs pa med de /
translated: If you say that it does not perform any function, then there is no misconception here.

original: de lta na ni 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would not be engaged.

original: don byed pa gzhan gyis mi slu bar 'gyur bar rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la ni cung zad kyang ma brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: don byed pa gzhan gyis mi slu bar 'gyur bar rigs so zhes bya ba 'di la ni cung zad kyang ma brjod do zhe na /
translated: But we have not said anything about this!

original: gzugs la sogs pa la yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la yang zhes smos so //
translated: The response to that is “Even in regard to form, etc.”

original: 'di dag rang gi rang bzhin rig pa 'ba' zhig nyid ni rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di dag rang gi rang bzhin rig pa 'ba' zhig nyid ni rig pa tsam mo //
translated: The mere awareness of the intrinsic nature of those is just awareness.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: “In regard to another” refers to the intrinsic nature of an action or

original: de'i sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin la'o //
translated: the intrinsic nature of its proof.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought here is this:

original: gal te yul 'dzin pa'i shes pa de nyid gzhan la yang tshad ma yin na ni de'i tshe des nye bar gzhag pa'i don byed pa de'i mi slu bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yul 'dzin pa'i shes pa de nyid gzhan la yang tshad ma yin na ni de'i tshe des nye bar gzhag pa'i don byed pa de'i mi slu bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the cognition that apprehends an object is a valid cognition in regard to another, then at that time the object that it posits would be nondeceptive.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “In regard to what?” and so on.

original: gal te gzhan dang gcig tu sgro 'dogs na de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dang gcig tu sgro 'dogs na de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
translated: If one attributes identity to another, then it would follow, absurdly, that

original: khyad par ston par byed pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par ston par byed pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show the distinction, he says “in regard to that.”

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la ni /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la ni /
translated: The nature of the future is

original: mthong bzhin de'i rgyu yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthong bzhin de'i rgyu yin pa nyid do //
translated: just the cause of what is seen.

original: yang na mthong bzhin de 'di'i rgyu yin pa nyid de /🔽nye bar len pa dang nye @215a * //
analyzed: yang na mthong bzhin de 'di'i rgyu yin pa nyid de / nye bar len pa dang nye @215a * //
translated: Or, the nature of the future is just the cause of what is seen,

original: bar len pa las byung ba'i dngos po nye ba nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dang tshogs pa gcig pa la rag las pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bar len pa las byung ba'i dngos po nye ba nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // de dang tshogs pa gcig pa la rag las pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is the appropriator and the thing arisen from the appropriator that is called “present.”🔽“Dependent on the same basis” means🔽dependent on the same form.

original: gzugs dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig la rag las ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig la rag las ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Dependent on the same basis” means dependent on the same collection, that is, dependent on the same form.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyang skabs kyis gang du rgyud rnam par dbye ba byed pa 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyang skabs kyis gang du rgyud rnam par dbye ba byed pa 'jug pa'am /
translated: The same collection is dependent on the stream-­entry of the continuum,

original: don gcig byed pa nyid khyad par can 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: don gcig byed pa nyid khyad par can 'dod pa yin te /
translated: or it is the special activity of a single object.

original: gzhan du na du ba dang thal ba bzhin du gsal bar 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na du ba dang thal ba bzhin du gsal bar 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, like smoke and ashes, there would be a clear error.

original: ci skad du bshad pa gcig tu lhag par zhen pa med na tshad ma nyid med par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ci skad du bshad pa gcig tu lhag par zhen pa med na tshad ma nyid med par brjod pa ni /
translated: If one does not adhere to the literal meaning of the words, then the statement “it is not a valid cognition” is related to the following:

original: smig rgyu la chur shes pa gang la chus bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba las smig rgyus bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur shes pa gang la chus bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba las smig rgyus bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of water in a mirage is not a valid cognition with regard to the object to be established by water, but it is a valid cognition with regard to the object to be established by a mirage.

original: don byed pa tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa /
analyzed: don byed pa tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa /
translated: The difference in the object to be established is asserted.

original: chu'i shes pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: chu'i shes pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhes 'brel to //
translated: The cognition of water is not a valid cognition.

original: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par gyi mthar thug pa byed pa ni /
analyzed: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par gyi mthar thug pa byed pa ni /
translated: The general meaning of the statement is applied to the end of the specific meaning.

original: dper na chu 'dzin pa'i shes pa las zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: dper na chu 'dzin pa'i shes pa las zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: For example, “from the cognition apprehending water.”

original: / gal te chu dang smig rgyu dag gi tha dad pa la brten pa nyes pa yin la /
analyzed: / gal te chu dang smig rgyu dag gi tha dad pa la brten pa nyes pa yin la /
translated: If the fault is based on the difference between water and a mirage,🔽then how is the difference between seeing and obtaining averted?

original: mthong bzhin dang thob pa gnyis kyis tha dad pa gang gis zlog /'on te me'o zhes bya bar rtogs par mtshungs pas gcig nyid yin na /
analyzed: mthong bzhin dang thob pa gnyis kyis tha dad pa gang gis zlog /'on te me'o zhes bya bar rtogs par mtshungs pas gcig nyid yin na /
translated: But if they are the same in being understood as “fire,” then they are the same in being fire.

original: de'i tshe chu dang smig rgyu dag la yang dngos po nyid mtshungs pa des na /
analyzed: de'i tshe chu dang smig rgyu dag la yang dngos po nyid mtshungs pa des na /
translated: In that case, since the similarity of real things is the same for water and a mirage,

original: de la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is also the case.

original: don byed pa gnas pa yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa gnas pa yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the abiding of the functioning of the object is taught in general.

original: ri mo'i shes pa yang gi sgras bsdus pas kyang ci bya ste /
analyzed: ri mo'i shes pa yang gi sgras bsdus pas kyang ci bya ste /
translated: And what is to be done about the cognition of a painting, which is included by the word “etc.”?

original: shes pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid mi slu ba yin par 'gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid mi slu ba yin par 'gyur mod ce na /
translated: It is not deceptive with regard to the difference of one cognition from another.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said,

original: de lta bu kho nar bsams nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar bsams nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it is just as it is thought.🔽The following is a commentary on the section of the Pramānﬁ avārtika that

original: yang rnam 'grel gyi cha rjes su brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yang rnam 'grel gyi cha rjes su brjod pa ni /
translated: says:🔽The point of this is to show that the primary function of the teacher is to

original: mngon par 'dod pa de ston pa la gtsor byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa de ston pa la gtsor byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: teach what is desired.

original: 'dis ni don byed pa gnas pa tsam mi slu ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni don byed pa gnas pa tsam mi slu ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This shows that the mere abiding of the functioning of the object is not🔽nondeceptive, but rather that the abiding of the functioning of the object

original: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa don byed pa gnas pa yin par 'dod do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa don byed pa gnas pa yin par 'dod do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: that is desired is asserted to be nondeceptive.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from this?

original: de lta yin dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes smos so //
translated: It is said, “If that were the case . . . ”

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de la snam bu thob pa na bum pa'i shes pa tshad ma bkag pas ni chu'i shes pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la snam bu thob pa na bum pa'i shes pa tshad ma bkag pas ni chu'i shes pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, when a cognition of a cloth is obtained, the cognition of a pot is not refuted, and therefore the cognition of water is explained.

original: ji srid nya phyis ma thob kyi bar du dngul gyi shes pa yang nas yang du byung yang /
analyzed: ji srid nya phyis ma thob kyi bar du dngul gyi shes pa yang nas yang du byung yang /
translated: As long as a cognition of mother-of-pearl is not obtained, a cognition of silver occurs again and again.

original: mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba med pas tshad ma nyid yin pa bkag pas ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba med pas tshad ma nyid yin pa bkag pas ni /
translated: But since it is not nondeceptive with regard to what is desired, it is refuted as valid knowledge.

original: ri mo'i shes pa'i @215b rgyun du byung yang de tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: ri mo'i shes pa'i @215b rgyun du byung yang de tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Even though it occurs in the continuum of a cognition of a painting, it is not valid knowledge merely by that.

original: shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan ma skyes na tshad ma dang po'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan ma skyes na tshad ma dang po'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if another moment of cognition does not arise, the first moment of valid knowledge would not be valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir glog la sogs pa bzhin du dad po mthong ba yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir glog la sogs pa bzhin du dad po mthong ba yang /
translated: Therefore, like lightning and so on, even though it is seen at first,

original: mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is valid knowledge because it is nondeceptive with regard to what is desired.

original: mngon par 'dod pa slu med phyir //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa slu med phyir //
translated: Because it is nondeceptive with regard to what is desired,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: and so on,

original: sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: is a summary.

original: rigs mthun 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun 'dra ba'o //
translated: Similar means of the same type.

original: rigs mthun pa'i shes pa skye ba tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i shes pa skye ba tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the mere arising of a consciousness of a similar type,

original: dngul gyi shes pa'i rgyun yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngul gyi shes pa'i rgyun yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the continuum of a consciousness of silver would be a valid cognition.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa tsam gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa tsam gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the mere arising of a consciousness of a different type,

original: shin tu tha dad ba bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu tha dad ba bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the consciousness of a pot, which is completely different, would be a valid cognition.

original: gal te de lta na ngal ba mang pos mi slu ba khas blangs pa 'dis ci bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ngal ba mang pos mi slu ba khas blangs pa 'dis ci bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then what is the use of accepting that it is nondeceptive through many hardships?

original: rtogs pa tsam ni spyir tshad mar grub pa yin na /
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam ni spyir tshad mar grub pa yin na /
translated: It is in general established that mere understanding is a valid cognition,

original: gnod par byed pa dmigs kyis sel ba ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa dmigs kyis sel ba ni /
translated: and the elimination of the object of negation is done by the observation of what is contradictory to it.

original: spong bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid legs pa yin no zhe na /🔽gnod par byed pa'i shes pa'i rnam par gnas pa ste /🔽rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de yang de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid de /
analyzed: spong bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid legs pa yin no zhe na / gnod par byed pa'i shes pa'i rnam par gnas pa ste / rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de yang de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid de /
translated: It is better to say that the object of negation is eliminated by that which is contradictory to it.🔽 The object of negation is the mode of apprehension of a consciousness that is contradictory to the mode of apprehension of a valid cognition.

original: mi slu ba'i rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i rnam pa nyid do //
translated: The mode of apprehension of a valid cognition is the mode of apprehension of a consciousness that is nondeceptive.

original: dper na shes pa snga ma'i bsam pa'i dbang gis shes pa phi ma mi slu ba'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du gnod par byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa snga ma'i bsam pa'i dbang gis shes pa phi ma mi slu ba'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du gnod par byed pa yang yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the establishment of the subsequent cognition as non-deceptive due to the power of the intention of the prior cognition.

original: des na gnod byed kyi rnam par gnas pa yang mi slu ba'i rnam pa las yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod byed kyi rnam par gnas pa yang mi slu ba'i rnam pa las yin no //
translated: Thus, the mode of the refutation is also from the aspect of non-deceptiveness.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bor ma byas na ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bor ma byas na ni /
translated: If one does not take on the nature of what is desired,

original: don dam par gnod bya dang gnod byed kyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de nyid du na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par gnod bya dang gnod byed kyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de nyid du na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the ultimate existence of the entity of the refutable and the refutation is not the case.

original: don dam par ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa 'ba' zhig tu thad kyi /
analyzed: don dam par ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa 'ba' zhig tu thad kyi /
translated: In that case, the ultimate is only the arising of a cognition of a different type.

original: de gnod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a refutation,

original: sngar ci skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ci skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it was explained earlier.

original: lhag pa yang brjod pa ni /🔽gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa yang brjod pa ni / gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remainder is stated:🔽If a cognition of a different type...🔽is not accepted as a refutation,

original: rigs mthun pa'i shes pa skyes pa gnod byed du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i shes pa skyes pa gnod byed du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: then...

original: gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa skye ba gnod byed du gzhan 'dod na de'i tshe bum pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par bla'o //
analyzed: gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa skye ba gnod byed du gzhan 'dod na de'i tshe bum pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par bla'o //
translated: If you assert that the arising of consciousnesses of different types is the reason why, then it is easy to understand that the thought “This is a pot” and so on is the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: gal te min zhes bya ba gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te min zhes bya ba gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If not” is the opponent’s response.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa la yang gal te ma yin no snyam du shes pa lhan cig byed pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa la yang gal te ma yin no snyam du shes pa lhan cig byed pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the thought “This is not that” is the cause of the arising of consciousnesses of different types,🔽then it is the reason why.

original: gnod byed yin na /
analyzed: gnod byed yin na /
translated: “If” means

original: gang gi @216a * //
analyzed: gang gi @216a * //
translated: “when.”

original: tshe bum pa'i shes pa yod pa na /
analyzed: tshe bum pa'i shes pa yod pa na /
translated: When a consciousness of a pot exists,

original: snam bu'i shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni bum pa med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snam bu'i shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni bum pa med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: a consciousness of a cloth does not exist.

original: min no snyam pa'i zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: min no snyam pa'i zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: “If not” is the refutation.

original: 'ga' zhig gi sgrub pa dang 'gog pa rnam par rtog pas sgrub pa ngag ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi sgrub pa dang 'gog pa rnam par rtog pas sgrub pa ngag ni /
translated: Some proofs and refutations are established by conceptual thought.

original: bsgrub byar bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: bsgrub byar bstan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: The words that are taught as the probandum are the nature of the probandum.

original: gdon mi za bar tshad ma la ltos dgos te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar tshad ma la ltos dgos te /
translated: Therefore, they definitely must rely on valid knowledge.

original: de lta ma yin na ni thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be established.

original: des na gal te 'di bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te 'di bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it is related to mere latent potentialities,

original: de'i tshe de lta bu'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pas ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //🔽gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe de lta bu'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos pas ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o // gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
translated: then what is the use of depending on such a cooperative condition?

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma yod pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma yod pa yin la /
translated: Another says, The valid cognition that has the character of a nonentity exists,

original: de las ni ma yin no snyam pa'i shes pa 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las ni ma yin no snyam pa'i shes pa 'di yin zhe na /
translated: but it is not from that that this consciousness arises.

original: de dpyad bya zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //🔽de'am bdag yongs su ma gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de dpyad bya zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o // de'am bdag yongs su ma gyur pa'am /
translated: To this we reply, This is to be analyzed, which is a refutation.

original: yang na don gzhan shas pa yin zhes gzhan 'dod pa ma yin nam zhen bden te /🔽bdag dgos par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur bas stong pa tsam ni /
analyzed: yang na don gzhan shas pa yin zhes gzhan 'dod pa ma yin nam zhen bden te / bdag dgos par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par 'gyur bas stong pa tsam ni /
translated: Isn't it the case that others assert that it is either the transformation of the self or the apprehension of an object that is different from it? It is true that they do assert this.

original: med par dgag pa yin pas /
analyzed: med par dgag pa yin pas /
translated: But the mere fact that the self is empty of the nature of being a necessary object is a nonimplicative negation.

original: de ni ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi rtog pa'am /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi rtog pa'am /
translated: So how could it be the object of anyone's thought or word?

original: rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun dbyung bla ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun dbyung bla ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute that, he says, “It would be the cause of an understanding of non-entityness,” and so on.

original: yal bar dor nas /
analyzed: yal bar dor nas /
translated: Having refuted that,

original: yang na don gzhan shes pa yin //
analyzed: yang na don gzhan shes pa yin //
translated: he says, “Or else it would be the understanding of another object.”

original: zhes bya ba mdun du bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba mdun du bya ste /
translated: He brings that forward.

original: dper na gzhal bya gzhan mngon sum la sogs pas rig par bya ba de bzhin du dngos po med par yang shes pa gzhan gyis rig par bya bar brgya la 'dod par 'gyur snyam pas /
analyzed: dper na gzhal bya gzhan mngon sum la sogs pas rig par bya ba de bzhin du dngos po med par yang shes pa gzhan gyis rig par bya bar brgya la 'dod par 'gyur snyam pas /
translated: Just as the object of comprehension is known by other means of valid knowledge such as perception, in the same way, it is possible that non-entityness is known by another consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second conception.

original: ci de'i zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba'i'o ;
analyzed: ci de'i zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba'i'o ;
translated: “What is that?” refers to the object of negation.

original: / rnam par rtog pa dang po la brjod /
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa dang po la brjod /
translated: He says that the first conception is untenable.

original: khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It would follow that there would be no difference”

original: mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur pa ste /
translated: means that it would follow that there would be similarity.

original: gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig rtogs pas thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig rtogs pas thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands any one of them, all would be understood.

original: des na gzugs mthong ba na ro 'gog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzugs mthong ba na ro 'gog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that when one sees form, one would understand taste.

original: gal te yang don gzhan shes pa yin zhes bya ba 'dir shes pa gcig la 'khrul pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zla bo dmigs pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang don gzhan shes pa yin zhes bya ba 'dir shes pa gcig la 'khrul pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zla bo dmigs pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you say that the cognition of another object is not the same cognition as the cognition of the first object, then you are saying that the object of cognition is not the same as the cognition.

original: des na thal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na thal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: So how can there be a fallacy?

original: de nyid kyi phyir bram ze'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis dmigs par rung ba'i don ma dmigs pa @216b dngos po med pa'i sgrub byed yin no zhes bsgrags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bram ze'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis dmigs par rung ba'i don ma dmigs pa @216b dngos po med pa'i sgrub byed yin no zhes bsgrags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the followers of the Brahmana’s desire, who proclaim that the non-perception of a perceptible object is the proof of non-existence.

original: phyogs 'di la ci ltar grags pa'i mtho ris dang rnal 'byor pa dang / lus dang ldan pa'i lha la sogs pa ma bkag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ci ltar grags pa'i mtho ris dang rnal 'byor pa dang / lus dang ldan pa'i lha la sogs pa ma bkag pa ma yin nam /
translated: In this position, are not heaven, yogis, gods who possess bodies, and so on, known to exist?

original: de la ni mi shes pa gcig la 'dre blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni mi shes pa gcig la 'dre blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For them, it is impossible to see a ghost in one place and not know it in another.

original: des na dngos po med pa tshad mar smra ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa sod bar gyur to //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa tshad mar smra ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa sod bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, the activity of the person who advocates non-existence as valid cognition is finished.

original: des na gal te ji skad brjod pa'i zla bo'i shes pa ni 'di 'dod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba rigs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te ji skad brjod pa'i zla bo'i shes pa ni 'di 'dod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba rigs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if you do not assert that the consciousness of the object that is the counterpart of what is said to be nonexistent, then it is correct to say that it follows that there is no difference between the two.

original: 'o na dngos po la skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po la skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that this error does not apply to things,

original: de'i tshe yang nges pa'i rnam pa can zla bo mthong ba nyid gzhan med par nges pa skye bar nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang nges pa'i rnam pa can zla bo mthong ba nyid gzhan med par nges pa skye bar nus pa'i phyir /
translated: then even in that case, the ascertainment of the aspect of the object that is the counterpart of what is seen, without the other, is able to generate ascertainment.

original: de ni mngon sum gyi byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyi byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the activity of perception.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad mar smras pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad mar smras pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of calling it a valid cognition of nonexistence?

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The second misconception

original: dgag par bya ba de'i dngos med gang yin pa de rig na ni ste rig par khas len na /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba de'i dngos med gang yin pa de rig na ni ste rig par khas len na /
translated: If you say that you cognize the nonexistence of the thing that is to be refuted,

original: de'i zhes 'brel pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i zhes 'brel pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the statement “that” would be meaningless.

original: 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be related.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of that

original: med pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya bas yin te /
analyzed: med pa ni rang gi ngo bos zhes bya bas yin te /
translated: is “nonexistence by its very nature.”

original: khyod kyi khas blangs pa snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi khas blangs pa snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is what you accept.

original: de lta na yang de'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: But what is wrong with the relation of that?

original: dngos po med pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “of a non-existent entity.”

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang gang gis 'ga' zhig dang / 'brel par mthong ba de'i tshe 'brel pa can du nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa yang gang gis 'ga' zhig dang / 'brel par mthong ba de'i tshe 'brel pa can du nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: If a pot, etc. is seen to be related to something, then is it not ascertained as related?

original: de bzhin du dngos po med pa yin yang 'brel pa can dang lhan cig mthong ba na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po med pa yin yang 'brel pa can dang lhan cig mthong ba na /
translated: In the same way, even though it is a non-existent entity, when it is seen together with the related,

original: 'brel pa can du gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa can du gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: it is apprehended as related.

original: bum pa rtogs pa na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bum pa rtogs pa na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “when the pot is understood.”

original: de dang 'brel pa nyid ni bum pa dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa nyid ni bum pa dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The relation of that is the relation of the pot.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bum pa yod pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bum pa yod pa'i dus su'o //
translated: At that time means at the time the pot exists.

original: gal te dngos po dang dngos po med la dag dus mtshungs pa mi srid pa'i phyir gal te de'i tshe ma rtogs pa'i bum pa dang yang dngos po med pa 'brel par rig na de'i tshe skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po dang dngos po med la dag dus mtshungs pa mi srid pa'i phyir gal te de'i tshe ma rtogs pa'i bum pa dang yang dngos po med pa 'brel par rig na de'i tshe skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is impossible for an existent entity and a non-existent entity to be simultaneous, and if the non-existent entity is related to the pot that is not understood at that time, what is the problem?

original: ma rtogs pa'i bum pa dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i bum pa dang zhes smos so //
translated: and the non-apprehension of the pot.

original: pa rtogs pa ni 'brel pa can nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa rtogs pa ni 'brel pa can nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The apprehension of the pot does not have the capacity to ascertain the pot as related.

original: des na ci ltar gnyi ga dus gcig tu mi rtogs pa 'di rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du 'brel pa can nyid du nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: des na ci ltar gnyi ga dus gcig tu mi rtogs pa 'di rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du 'brel pa can nyid du nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, just as the non-apprehension of both occurs simultaneously, so too the ascertainment of the pot as related does not occur.

original: 'dir pha rol po gcig mthong yang gzhan gyi blo khong nas phyung nas 'brel pa @217a * //
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po gcig mthong yang gzhan gyi blo khong nas phyung nas 'brel pa @217a * //
translated: Here, the opponent thinks: “Even though one sees the other, the ascertainment of the pot as related does not occur, but the ascertainment of the pot as related does occur.

original: can nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin gyi blo mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: can nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin gyi blo mthong ba nyid de /
translated: The ascertainment of the pot as related is not the seeing of the pot itself.

original: gnyi ga dus gcig tu mthong ba la ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga dus gcig tu mthong ba la ni /
translated: For the seeing of both occurs simultaneously.

original: gdon mi za bar ltos par bya ba ma yin no snyam pa na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar ltos par bya ba ma yin no snyam pa na /
translated: It is not necessary to rely on the ascertainment of the pot as related.”

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response, the root text states, “If that were so . . .”

original: dngos po med pa dang bum pa 'brel pa nyid du rtogs so zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang bum pa 'brel pa nyid du rtogs so zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the non-existence of the pot and the pot are ascertained as related.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni rgyu yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po yod na zhes bya ba ni sngar ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni rgyu yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po yod na zhes bya ba ni sngar ro //
translated: In order to clarify this, he says, “If the cause exists,” and so on. “ If the thing exists” is as previously explained.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ If the thing does not exist”

original: zhig nas med pa'o //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa'o //
translated: means that it is destroyed and does not exist.

original: dngos po med pa yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ If the thing does not exist”

original: snga na med pa yod na'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa yod na'o //
translated: means that it is nonexistent prior to its existence.

original: dngos po yin pas zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yin pas zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Because the thing exists” refers to such things as the sprout.

original: dngos po med pa'i rgyu spangs pa na ma khyab pa'i tshul 'di dgod par mi 'os so snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rgyu spangs pa na ma khyab pa'i tshul 'di dgod par mi 'os so snyam du bsams nas /
translated: If the cause of a nonexistent thing is refuted, it is not appropriate to set forth this mode of nonpervasion.

original: de yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thinking this, he says, “That also is not so.”

original: 'o na ni ri bong gi rva med pa zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'o na ni ri bong gi rva med pa zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: If the horn of a rabbit does not exist, then it cannot be said to be nonexistent.

original: ri bong gi rva dngos po ltar yod na med pa de 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dngos po ltar yod na med pa de 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
translated: If the horn of a rabbit exists like a thing, then it cannot be nonexistent.

original: der ni zlog pa dngos po med pa yod na dngos por 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni zlog pa dngos po med pa yod na dngos por 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And in that case, if the opposite, the nonexistent thing, exists, then it cannot be a thing.

original: de ltar gyur na ni zhig nas med pa dang snga na med pa dag kho na dngos po dang 'brel par brjod par 'gyur gyi gtan med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni zhig nas med pa dang snga na med pa dag kho na dngos po dang 'brel par brjod par 'gyur gyi gtan med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then only that which has disintegrated and does not exist and that which did not exist previously would be said to be related to a thing, but it is not utterly nonexistent.

original: zhig nas med pa dang / snga na med pa dag la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu ltar dngos po dang 'brel la /
analyzed: zhig nas med pa dang / snga na med pa dag la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu ltar dngos po dang 'brel la /
translated: And in regard to that which has disintegrated and does not exist and that which did not exist previously, they are related to a thing as cause and effect.

original: 'brel pa'i blo legs pa ma yin no zhes skyon gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa ni /🔽gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i blo legs pa ma yin no zhes skyon gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa ni / gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, “It is not right to have the idea that they are related,” shows another fault.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: Moreover, if the nature of cause and effect

original: gnyis pa de med par yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis pa de med par yang ngo //
translated: were to exist in the absence of the other,

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car ma dmigs pa de lta na yang gzhan dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na gcig gi rang bzhin rtogs pa yod pa yin no ;
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car ma dmigs pa de lta na yang gzhan dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na gcig gi rang bzhin rtogs pa yod pa yin no ;
translated: even if cause and effect were not observed simultaneously, the nature of one would be perceived in the state of separation from the other.

original: / des na sngar nyams su myong ba'i sa bon /
analyzed: / des na sngar nyams su myong ba'i sa bon /
translated: Therefore, the seed that was previously experienced

original: myu gu'i dus su dran pas rnam par bzhag nas 'di'i 'bras bu yin no zhes 'brel pa grub pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: myu gu'i dus su dran pas rnam par bzhag nas 'di'i 'bras bu yin no zhes 'brel pa grub pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Having established the connection by remembering at the time of the sprout, “This is the effect of that,” it is in accordance with that.

original: de ltar rtogs pa na yang dus gzhan du sa bon tsam mthong ba na /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa na yang dus gzhan du sa bon tsam mthong ba na /
translated: And when it is understood in that way, then when one sees just the seed at another time,

original: myu gu khong nas phyung ste /
analyzed: myu gu khong nas phyung ste /
translated: the sprout is drawn out from within,

original: myu gu'i rgyu ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar yang bde blag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myu gu'i rgyu ni 'di yin no zhes bya bar yang bde blag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is easily understood that “This is the cause of the sprout.”

original: de bzhin du dngos po med pa 'di ni dngos po dang bral ba'i dus na rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po med pa 'di ni dngos po dang bral ba'i dus na rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, this nonexistence is not understood at the time of the separation from the thing.

original: des ji ltar na dngos po'i dus su de khong nas dbyung /
analyzed: des ji ltar na dngos po'i dus su de khong nas dbyung /
translated: So how could it be drawn out from within at the time of the thing?

original: de nyid du na zhes bya ba de don dam bar ro //🔽bag chags las byung ba'i tha snyad tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: de nyid du na zhes bya ba de don dam bar ro // bag chags las byung ba'i tha snyad tsam gyis ni /
translated: “In that very way” means ultimately.🔽But by the mere convention that arises from the latent propensities,

original: bum pa'i @217b dngos med ces 'brel lam du zhugs pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa'i @217b dngos med ces 'brel lam du zhugs pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the nonexistence of the pot is connected, and it appears to the conceptual mind.

original: des na de lta bu'i rang bzhin med kyang sa phyogs la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par du 'brel pa nyid kyis tha snyad du slu ba'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de lta bu'i rang bzhin med kyang sa phyogs la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par du 'brel pa nyid kyis tha snyad du slu ba'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, although there is no such nature, the place, etc. are not the basis of error conventionally, because of the connection with the particular nature of the thing.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par yang de bum pa la ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par yang de bum pa la ldog pa nyid do //
translated: And the particular nature is just the opposite of the pot.

original: gal te ldog pa dngos po med pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa dngos po med pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is not the opposite a non-thing?”

original: dngos po med pa ni mi bden mod kyi dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya gzhan nam tha dad par nyams su myong bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni mi bden mod kyi dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya gzhan nam tha dad par nyams su myong bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: It is not true that a non-thing is a non-thing, but it is not experienced as a different or separate object of cognition of a non-thing.

original: de las ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: de las ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
translated: The nature of the opposite of that is

original: 'di log pa zhes khyad par gzhan spong bas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di log pa zhes khyad par gzhan spong bas brjod pa yin no //
translated: expressed by the exclusion of other particularities, saying, “This is not that.”🔽If it is said,

original: gal te / med la dbye ba 'di dag tu //
analyzed: gal te / med la dbye ba 'di dag tu //
translated: “These divisions would not be possible🔽if it did not exist,

original: mi 'gyur de 'di dngos po nyid //🔽ces brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'gyur de 'di dngos po nyid // ces brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: and that is a thing.”

original: dngos po med pa yod pa'i dngos po nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yod pa'i dngos po nyid de /
translated: The existence of a non-thing is a thing.

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa dbye ba rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa dbye ba rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the divisions of non-existence, etc. are well-established.

original: stong pa'i yul gang yin pa zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: stong pa'i yul gang yin pa zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The master says, “The object of emptiness.🔽”

original: / stong pa ni gzhan la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: / stong pa ni gzhan la ltos pa ste /
translated: Emptiness is dependent on another,

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽snga na med pa'i dus su sa phyogs kyi bum pas stod pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba nyid ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i don to // snga na med pa'i dus su sa phyogs kyi bum pas stod pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba nyid ni /

original: zhig nas med pa'i dus su yang yin no //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa'i dus su yang yin no //

analyzed: des na stong pa'i yul ni dngos po med pa thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid do //

original: de'i phyir de kho na ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na ma yin pas na /

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i dbye ba nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i dbye ba nyid ni /

original: dngos po bsgrub pa la nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po bsgrub pa la nus pa ma yin no //

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba tsam gyis ni /

original: de kho na ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na ma yin par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang de bzhin du thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /

original: ci ltar dngos po dbye ba ni //🔽zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po dbye ba ni // zhes smos so //
translated: How is the differentiation of things

analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te / gal te bum pa la sogs pa ltar dngos po med pa'i dbye ba /

analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bden pa yin na /

analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba kho na bzhin du tha dad par gzhan gyi mngon sum la snang bar 'gyur na /

analyzed: de lta na yang ma yin no //

original: de'i phyir rtags med par skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni mngon sum gyi rjes su gzung ba kho na yid ches par bya ba 'os pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags med par skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni mngon sum gyi rjes su gzung ba kho na yid ches par bya ba 'os pa yin gyi /

original: gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir na /

analyzed: @218a * // gzhan gyis byas pa'i rab tu dbye ba nyid kyis ni dngos po nyid du yid ches pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub byed ni gdon mi za bar mngon sum la mi ltos pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin mtha' dag mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: dngos med yin 'dod na zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma'o //

analyzed: des na kun du gnyid log pas khams gsum pa'i dngos po med par rig par mi thal lo snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that it does not follow that one knows the non-existence of things in the three realms by being completely asleep.

original: lan smras pa ni /
analyzed: lan smras pa ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: de ni dngos po rig med par //
analyzed: de ni dngos po rig med par //
translated: That is not the knowledge of the non-existence of things.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is what is said.

analyzed: @218b bum pa la sogs pa'am rtogs pa'o 'ga' zhig go //

original: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i blo ni ser po la sogs pa la gdon mi za bar mi ltos pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i blo dang sa phyogs la sogs pa'i zla'o rtogs pa la ji ltar ltos /

translated: Just as the cognition of blue and so on does not depend on yellow and so on, in the same way, how could the cognition apprehending a pot and so on depend on the cognition of the place and so on?

original: gzhan dran pa med na sngon po la sogs pa'i rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dran pa med na sngon po la sogs pa'i rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that without remembering the other, the cognition of blue and so on does not occur.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba ste /🔽dngos dang 'brel pa gzung bya zhing //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ste / dngos dang 'brel pa gzung bya zhing //
translated: If it is so,🔽then the related object should be apprehended,

original: 'gal zla dag kyang dran byas nas //
analyzed: 'gal zla dag kyang dran byas nas //
translated: and the opposite should be remembered.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what is said.

original: sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The refutation:

original: gal te de lta yin na de'i che tshogs pas shes pa tsam skye ba zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de'i che tshogs pas shes pa tsam skye ba zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is so, then it would be called the mere arising of cognition due to the assembly of those,

original: dngos po med pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni med par gyur to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni med par gyur to //
translated: but this so-called apprehension of a non-existent thing would be non-existent.

original: gal te sngon po mthong ba na snang ba dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: gal te sngon po mthong ba na snang ba dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la ltos nas /
translated: If when seeing blue, depending on the assembly of light, sense faculty, and so on,

original: ci de'i tshe sngon po ma bzung bar 'gyur ram zhes dogs pa la /🔽dngos po las ni tha dad pa ;
analyzed: ci de'i tshe sngon po ma bzung bar 'gyur ram zhes dogs pa la / dngos po las ni tha dad pa ;
translated: In response to the question, “Wouldn’t blue be unapprehended at that time?”

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: [Nāgārjuna] states, “From an entity, it is different.”

original: 'di snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bsams pa yin te /
translated: This is what he is thinking.

original: sngon po mthong ba na mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas /
analyzed: sngon po mthong ba na mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas /
translated: When blue is seen, non-blue is excluded.

original: dbang po la sogs pa khongs su 'dus pa na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa khongs su 'dus pa na /
translated: When the sense faculty and so on are included,

original: yul yang der 'dus pa'i phyir gzhan gyis dben par yul gyi rang bzhin la mngon par phyogs pa'i blo skye ba yin no //
analyzed: yul yang der 'dus pa'i phyir gzhan gyis dben par yul gyi rang bzhin la mngon par phyogs pa'i blo skye ba yin no //
translated: since the object is also included there, the cognition that is directed toward the nature of the object, which is isolated from other things, arises.

original: de bzhin du gal te dngos po med pa yang tshogs pa de'i khongs su gtogs pas rang gi yul can gyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe de yang gzhan gyi rang bzhin las log pa'i rang bzhin snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te dngos po med pa yang tshogs pa de'i khongs su gtogs pas rang gi yul can gyi blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe de yang gzhan gyi rang bzhin las log pa'i rang bzhin snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if a nonentity is also included in that collection and is a cause of the cognition that has it as its object, then it follows that it would appear as a nature that is the opposite of the nature of other things.

original: des na dngos po las ni tha dad ces bya ba 'dis thal ba zlog par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po las ni tha dad ces bya ba 'dis thal ba zlog par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, “From an entity, it is different” is stated to reverse the absurd consequence.

original: dngos po las ni zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs sam bum pa las so //
analyzed: dngos po las ni zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs sam bum pa las so //
translated: “From an entity” means from the place or the pot.

original: de'i phyir sngon po bzhin du dngos po med pa ni yul nyid kyis tshogs pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i skyed byed ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po bzhin du dngos po med pa ni yul nyid kyis tshogs pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i skyed byed ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like blue, a non-thing is not a producer that is included in the collection of causes and conditions of that consciousness.

original: des na yul la mi ltos pa'i tshogs pa de tsam las skyes pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: des na yul la mi ltos pa'i tshogs pa de tsam las skyes pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: Thus, a consciousness that arises from just that much of a collection of causes and conditions that does not rely on an object

original: yul med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yul med pa kho na'o //
translated: has no object at all.

original: 'di skad du rtog pa ma gtogs pa dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gzhan ni med do zhes brjod pa yin no //🔽'di med ces bya ba'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba ni phyir zlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du rtog pa ma gtogs pa dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gzhan ni med do zhes brjod pa yin no // 'di med ces bya ba'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba ni phyir zlog pa'o //
translated: This is what is being said: “Apart from the conception, there is no other so-called non-thing.”🔽“The consciousness that thinks ‘this does not exist’” is a response.

original: de yi ldog pa rig yin na //
analyzed: de yi ldog pa rig yin na //
translated: “Its negation is known.”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what it means.

original: bum pa la sogs pa de'i ldog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa de'i ldog pa med pa'o //
translated: “The negation of a pot, etc., does not exist.”

original: yang na de las tha dad rig yin na //
analyzed: yang na de las tha dad rig yin na //
translated: Or, “Its difference is known.”

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it means.

original: dngos po med pa @219a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa @219a * //
translated: “A non-thing

original: dngos po las tha dad par rig na'o //
analyzed: dngos po las tha dad par rig na'o //
translated: is known as different from a thing.”

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: The refutation is this:

original: de ni gang las skyes pa yin //
analyzed: de ni gang las skyes pa yin //
translated: “From what does it arise?”

original: zhes bya'o // dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul las skye bar khas len na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul las skye bar khas len na /
translated: If you accept that it arises from an object that has the characteristic of non-existence,

original: gzhan gyis bden par mngon sum du byed par thal lo snyam du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bden par mngon sum du byed par thal lo snyam du dogs pa'o //
translated: then it follows that others would directly perceive true existence.

original: brgya la gzhan dbang po nyid rgyur smra bar 'gyur bas smras pa ni dran med dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brgya la gzhan dbang po nyid rgyur smra bar 'gyur bas smras pa ni dran med dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: If you say that the sense faculty itself is the cause, then the response is that it is “a sense faculty without memory.”

original: sngar mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dran pa med par dbang po 'ba' zhig ni rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dran pa med par dbang po 'ba' zhig ni rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the sense faculty alone, without memory of the previously seen pot and so on, is the cause.

original: 'on kyang dran pa nyid du shes pa dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dran pa nyid du shes pa dogs pa'o //
translated: However, it is suspected that it is memory itself that is the cause.

original: gal te nges pa 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te nges pa 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: If you ask, “What is this ascertainment?”

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i byed pa 'jug pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i byed pa 'jug pa la /
translated: It is because the activity of the sense faculty engages in the object.

original: bum pa yang drin pa des na bum pa med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa yang drin pa des na bum pa med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If the pot is not there, then the pot is not there.”

original: 'dir bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsam par bya ste /
translated: Here you should consider the following.

original: dbang po de dngos po med pa la byed pa 'jug gam sa phyogs la sogs pa gzhan la /
analyzed: dbang po de dngos po med pa la byed pa 'jug gam sa phyogs la sogs pa gzhan la /
translated: Does the sense faculty engage in activity with respect to a non-existent object or with respect to another object, such as a place?

original: phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni /
translated: With regard to the first possibility, it is said:

original: dbang po dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “the sense faculty endowed with memory.”

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba ste /
translated: “Endowed” means “connected.”

original: dbang pos dngos po med pa dang ldan par gyur pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: dbang pos dngos po med pa dang ldan par gyur pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: The sense faculty is connected to the object, which is the particular and the universal, the characteristic and the characterized.

original: yul mi nye ba'i dbang po yod pa tsam ni shes pa de'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yul mi nye ba'i dbang po yod pa tsam ni shes pa de'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The mere presence of the sense faculty, without the object being present, is not the cause of that cognition.

original: des na dbang po dang dran pa dang / dbang po dang yul phrad pa de las dngos po med pa'i shes pa 'byung bar khas len na ni /
analyzed: des na dbang po dang dran pa dang / dbang po dang yul phrad pa de las dngos po med pa'i shes pa 'byung bar khas len na ni /
translated: Therefore, if you accept that a cognition of the absence of a thing arises from the contact of the sense faculty and the object,

original: dngos po med pa'i shes pa de ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i shes pa de ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: then that cognition of the absence of a thing would be a form of perception.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas ni ma yin te /
translated: It would not be a valid cognition of the absence of a thing.

original: dper na rigs pa can rnams kyi lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na rigs pa can rnams kyi lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be like the perception of the Sāṃkhyas.

original: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bor snang ba rnyed par dka' bas mngon sum du yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bor snang ba rnyed par dka' bas mngon sum du yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, since it is difficult to find the appearance of its own nature, how could it be perception?

original: khyod 'dod pas 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gyur gyi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: khyod 'dod pas 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gyur gyi sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verbal root “to become” is “to be like this because of your desire.”

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa slong bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa slong bar byed pa ni /
translated: The second alternative is raised:

original: gal te dbang po gzhan la 'jug na zhes bya ba ste sa phyogs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang po gzhan la 'jug na zhes bya ba ste sa phyogs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “If it engages another sense faculty,” i.e., in the case of a patch of earth, etc.

original: lan du'o // 'o na gzhan shes rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: lan du'o // 'o na gzhan shes rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The response: “But it is not the cause of the cognition of another.”

original: dbang po zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba lhag ma ste /
translated: The remainder: “sense faculty.”

original: dngos po med par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin no ;
analyzed: dngos po med par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin no ;
translated: It is not the cause of the cognition of a non-existent object.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: med shes nyid na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med shes nyid na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If it is the cognition of non-existence,” etc.

original: yul la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it does not depend on an object.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
translated: The opponent says:

original: med shes de ni ma yin te //
analyzed: med shes de ni ma yin te //
translated: “That is not the cognition of non-existence.”

original: slu ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: The connection is: “because it is non-deceptive.”

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: mi slu ba las tshad ma yin gyi skye ba yul la ltos @219b pas go ci zhig bya zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi slu ba las tshad ma yin gyi skye ba yul la ltos @219b pas go ci zhig bya zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “It is valid knowledge because it is non-deceptive. What need is there for it to depend on an object?”

original: 'di la bzhad gad du byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bzhad gad du byed pa ni /
translated: The ridicule of this is:🔽“If it is valid knowledge because it is non-deceptive,

original: de ni tshad ma gzhan nyid cig / ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma gzhan nyid cig / ces bya'o //
translated: It is a different kind of valid cognition.

original: yul la mi ltos par skye ba yin yang mi slu ba can gang yin pa de ni tshad ma gzhan kho na zhig go //
analyzed: yul la mi ltos par skye ba yin yang mi slu ba can gang yin pa de ni tshad ma gzhan kho na zhig go //
translated: Even though it arises without depending on an object, it is a different kind of valid cognition if it is non-deceptive.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang brgyud nas yul las skyes pa nyid mi slu bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang brgyud nas yul las skyes pa nyid mi slu bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Even inference is non-deceptive because it arises from an object, albeit indirectly.
