translated: At that time refers to direct perception.

original: bstan bcos ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The treatise is not like that means

original: gang gis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag bzhin du 'dir skyon du 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag bzhin du 'dir skyon du 'gyur /
translated: by what fault here would direct perception and inference be like this?

original: nye ba'i mtshan nyid tsam gyi yul can nam /
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshan nyid tsam gyi yul can nam /
translated: The subject is merely a proximate characteristic,

original: 'brel ba 'dzin pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba 'dzin pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: not dependent on apprehending a connection.

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las so //
translated: From that itself means from the treatise.

original: 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni len no //🔽don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni len no // don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
translated: The words in this regard and so on are the response.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The words the reality of the object is not dependent mean that

original: phyi'i don dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the object is not dependent on the external object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smra ba po'i 'dod pas yul du byas pa kho na la tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smra ba po'i 'dod pas yul du byas pa kho na la tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the words it is a valid cognition only in regard to what is made the object by the desire of the speaker mean that

original: dngos po ni de lta bu 'am gzhan du ni yin zhes nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po ni de lta bu 'am gzhan du ni yin zhes nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is not certain that the object is either like that or otherwise.

original: gal te sgra rnams ni smra ba bo nyes pas skyon chags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgra rnams ni smra ba bo nyes pas skyon chags pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you say, Are not words defective because of the speaker's faults?

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It is said:

original: skyes bus byas pa dag la ni //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa dag la ni //
translated: In regard to what is produced by a person,

original: nyes pa yod med brtags par rigs //
analyzed: nyes pa yod med brtags par rigs //
translated: it is proper to examine whether there is a fault or not.

original: byed po med phyir rig byed la //
analyzed: byed po med phyir rig byed la //
translated: Since there is no creator,

original: nges pa'i dogs nged de la med //
analyzed: nges pa'i dogs nged de la med //
translated: there is no doubt about the Veda.

original: ce'o // de sna bstan bcos gzhan tshad ma ma yin mod /
analyzed: ce'o // de sna bstan bcos gzhan tshad ma ma yin mod /
translated: If you say, Well, other treatises are not valid, but

original: skyes bus byas pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: they are not produced by a person,

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i sgra ni med do zhes phyis bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i sgra ni med do zhes phyis bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: we will show later that there are no words that are not produced by a person.

original: phyis bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyis bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Later” refers to the following verse.

original: de'i brjod pa nyid las de la smra ba bo yod par rtogs so zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: de'i brjod pa nyid las de la smra ba bo yod par rtogs so zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: From the mere expression of that, one understands that there is a speaker.

original: gal te skyes bus byas pa ma yin na 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bus byas pa ma yin na 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not created by a person, then what is it?

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid ni 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid ni 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is created by a person.

original: skyes bus byas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa kho na ste /
translated: It is created by a person.

original: ci lta bu'i go rims bkod pa ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su @225b 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci lta bu'i go rims bkod pa ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su @225b 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The order in which it is arranged is seen to follow the affirmation and negation of the desire of a person.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In that case” means

original: ngag skyes bus byas par gnas pa na'o //
analyzed: ngag skyes bus byas par gnas pa na'o //
translated: when it is established that speech is created by a person.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i ngon 'grel pa ni smra ba bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i ngon 'grel pa ni smra ba bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commentary on the meaning of the verse begins with “The speaker . . .

original: gal te smra bar 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te smra bar 'dod pa yin la /
translated: If one desires to speak,

original: 'dod pa las 'bad rtsol /
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'bad rtsol /
translated: from the desire there is effort.

original: 'bad rtsol ba las ni gnas dang byed pa phrad pa'i rang bzhin skyes bu'i byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol ba las ni gnas dang byed pa phrad pa'i rang bzhin skyes bu'i byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: From the effort, is not the activity of a person created, which has the nature of the contact of the object and the sense faculty?

original: des na ci ltar 'dod pa nyid byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'dod pa nyid byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is it that does what one wants?

original: brjod par skul bar byed pa po'i 'bad rtsol las skul byed nyid gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par skul bar byed pa po'i 'bad rtsol las skul byed nyid gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The instigator is not different from the effort of the instigator.

original: des na skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol nyid rkan la sogs pa'i skul ba byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol nyid rkan la sogs pa'i skul ba byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the effort of the person is the instigator of the palate, etc.

original: da yang 'dod pa la ltos pa'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pas de nyid byed pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: da yang 'dod pa la ltos pa'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pas de nyid byed pa yin par brjod do //
translated: Moreover, since it depends on what is wanted, the result is figuratively designated as the cause, and that is said to be the doer.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That is of two kinds:

original: gang gis de rjod par byed pa'i tshig sbyor ba la 'jug par byed pa don 'di bstan par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can ni gcig yin la /
analyzed: gang gis de rjod par byed pa'i tshig sbyor ba la 'jug par byed pa don 'di bstan par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can ni gcig yin la /
translated: One is the kind that causes one to engage in the use of words that express it, thinking, “I will teach this meaning.”

original: sgrub pa'i tshig nyid brjod pa cam la 'jug par byed pa yang gang yin pa de ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i tshig nyid brjod pa cam la 'jug par byed pa yang gang yin pa de ni gzhan yin no //
translated: The other is that which causes one to engage in the mere expression of the words that prove it.

original: de la 'di ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Of these, the former is not to be accepted,

original: don ston pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ston pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the occasion is for teaching the meaning.

original: des na dang po 'dzin pa na smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni byed po nyid smras ba bor gzung ngo //
analyzed: des na dang po 'dzin pa na smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni byed po nyid smras ba bor gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, when the first is grasped, the so-called “object of the speaker’s desire to speak” is grasped as the very agent of speaking.

original: brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don ston par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni don ston par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The so-called “desire to speak” is the desire to teach the object.

original: spyi'i don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: spyi'i don brjod pa ni /
translated: The general meaning is stated:

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul gyi don ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul gyi don ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The object of the object of the desire to speak” and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: By this “object of the desire to speak,”

original: ston pa po'i blo la yang gsal bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa po'i blo la yang gsal bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: the clarity in the mind of the teacher is also stated.

original: rab rib can gnyis bzhin du gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir na de nyid smra ba po dang nyan pa po gnyi ga la yang snang ngo zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: rab rib can gnyis bzhin du gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir na de nyid smra ba po dang nyan pa po gnyi ga la yang snang ngo zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Because of the adherence to the one as the same as the other, like the two with eye disease, it is conventionally said that “it appears to both the speaker and the hearer.”

original: de kho na nyid du ni de bdag nyid so so la tha dad pa shes pa'i rnam pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni de bdag nyid so so la tha dad pa shes pa'i rnam pa tsam nyid do //
translated: But in reality, it is merely the aspect of the cognition of the individual’s own nature.

original: tha dad pa de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: tha dad pa de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because of the difference,

original: de nyid la sgra tshad ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa smra ba po sems kyi rnam pa la yin te /
analyzed: de nyid la sgra tshad ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa smra ba po sems kyi rnam pa la yin te /
translated: That itself is a valid means of linguistic knowledge” means that it is in the mental aspect of the speaker who is the cause.

original: 'bras bu ni smra ba po'i sems kyi rnam pa rjes su dpog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni smra ba po'i sems kyi rnam pa rjes su dpog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result is the inference of the mental aspect of the speaker.

original: sgra'i byed pa ni nyid la yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po las sems la gnas pa la ste /
analyzed: sgra'i byed pa ni nyid la yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po las sems la gnas pa la ste /
translated: “The function of the sound is in the mental aspect of the listener” means that it is in the mental aspect of the listener who is the result.

original: de ni sgra'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgra'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the result of the sound.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te mngon par rlom pa las smra ba po'i sems la gnas pa gang @226a * //
analyzed: gal te mngon par rlom pa las smra ba po'i sems la gnas pa gang @226a * //
translated: If the mental aspect of the speaker that is based on the speaker’s pride

original: yin de nyid rtogs pa po'i sems la yang yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: yin de nyid rtogs pa po'i sems la yang yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: is also in the mental aspect of the listener,

original: gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i phyir na /
translated: then because it is related to both,

original: gnyi ga'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: it is a convention of both.

original: gal te smra ba po'i sems la gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di med de gzhan du yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te smra ba po'i sems la gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di med de gzhan du yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
translated: If you suspect that there is no certainty that what is present in the speaker's mind is what is to be taught, because it is seen otherwise,

original: lan du gzhan du brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan du gzhan du brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the answer is: Otherwise, it is said that what is intended is expressed otherwise.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan du bsam pa gzhan du ston pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan du bsam pa gzhan du ston pa yin na /
translated: Even so, means that if the thought is one thing and the expression is something else,

original: smra ba po'i sems kyi rnam pa 'am /
analyzed: smra ba po'i sems kyi rnam pa 'am /
translated: it is very clear that the form of the speaker's mind or

original: phyi'i don tshad ma ma yin par shin tu gsal lo //
analyzed: phyi'i don tshad ma ma yin par shin tu gsal lo //
translated: an external object is not a valid cognition.

original: de kho nar rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de kho nar rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since there is no cause and effect in reality,

original: sgra brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par la tshad ma yin par bsgrubs pa ni legs pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa'i rgyan gyis yin no //
analyzed: sgra brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par la tshad ma yin par bsgrubs pa ni legs pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa'i rgyan gyis yin no //
translated: it is good to establish that sound is a valid cognition with regard to the particular thing that is intended to be expressed. This is the ornament of reasoning.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: nges pa'i don rnam par brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par la gdon mi za bar sgra rnams tshad ma yin no zhes ni de kho bo cag mi 'dod kyi //
analyzed: nges pa'i don rnam par brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par la gdon mi za bar sgra rnams tshad ma yin no zhes ni de kho bo cag mi 'dod kyi //
translated: But we who wish to express the definitive meaning certainly do not accept that words are valid cognitions with regard to the particular that is the object of expression.

original: 'on kyang phyi'i don la tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod par zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi'i don la tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod par zad do //
translated: We simply say that they are not valid cognitions with regard to external objects.

original: gal te rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par la yang tshad ma yin pa zlog par byed na de'i tshe nges la tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gal te rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par la yang tshad ma yin pa zlog par byed na de'i tshe nges la tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
translated: If you refute the fact that words are valid cognitions with regard to the particular that is the object of expression, then you are refuting the fact that there are any valid cognitions at all.

original: tha snyad tsam du brjod par 'dod pas sgrub pa'i don la tsha dmar brjod kyi //
analyzed: tha snyad tsam du brjod par 'dod pas sgrub pa'i don la tsha dmar brjod kyi //
translated: We say that words are valid cognitions with regard to their object of expression, which is merely a convention.

original: de kho nar ni ma yin no //🔽yang ji ltar na sgra rnams brjod par 'dod pa'i yul la tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de kho nar ni ma yin no // yang ji ltar na sgra rnams brjod par 'dod pa'i yul la tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: We do not say that they are valid cognitions with regard to reality.

original: don gyi de kho na'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin zhes dogs na /🔽rjod par 'dod pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don gyi de kho na'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin zhes dogs na / rjod par 'dod pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you wonder how words are valid cognitions with regard to the object of expression but are not valid cognitions with regard to the reality of the object,🔽the root text states, “That object of expression is also . . .”🔽The word “also” means that

original: yang ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: yang ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: Also means “for what reason.”🔽

original: de'i phyir zhes de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di dang 'brel ba'o//
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di dang 'brel ba'o//
translated: Therefore is connected with the immediately following explanation.

original: thams cad 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa rig pa'i thams cad rig pa ni ma yin gyi /🔽'on kyang 'ga' zhig 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa rig pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa rig pa'i thams cad rig pa ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang 'ga' zhig 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa rig pa yin no //
translated: Not all know everything, but some know the other world, etc.

original: des na de'i tshig nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de'i tshig nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, his words alone are valid,

original: thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: but not all are.

original: gal te thams cad thams cad rig pa yin mod 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na ;
analyzed: gal te thams cad thams cad rig pa yin mod 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na ;
translated: If all know everything, what contradiction is there?

original: 'di lta ma yin na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ma yin na zhes gsungs te /
translated: If it were not so, he says.

original: 'dod pa gcig tu 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa gcig tu 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: He thinks that there would be only one desire.

original: thams cad 'tshe ba 'gog pa dang ci zhig ltar de sgrub pa ni 'dod pa gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad 'tshe ba 'gog pa dang ci zhig ltar de sgrub pa ni 'dod pa gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the same desire to stop all harm and to establish it somehow.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang ngo //
translated: It is the same with others.

original: phan tshun 'grel ba'i lam dag ni 'bras bu gcig nyid kyang @226b ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'grel ba'i lam dag ni 'bras bu gcig nyid kyang @226b ma yin no //
translated: The paths of mutual interpretation do not have the same result.

original: 'o na mtshungs par rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na mtshungs par rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Well then, because they are similar causes,

original: gnyi ga gcig la 'jug mod 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga gcig la 'jug mod 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if both are applied to one, the result will occur.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don dag ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don dag ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, “But the meaning of mutually contradictory things . . . ”

original: 'tshe ba dang mi 'tshe ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i skabs so //
analyzed: 'tshe ba dang mi 'tshe ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i skabs so //
translated: The phrase “harm and non-harm, etc.” is the context.

original: gcig la sgrub byed kyi nus pa nges pa med na ni spang bya dang blang bya dag rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la sgrub byed kyi nus pa nges pa med na ni spang bya dang blang bya dag rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no definite capacity to establish one thing, then one cannot distinguish what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted.

original: gcig la nus pa ma nges pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: gcig la nus pa ma nges pa ma yin mod /
translated: It is not the case that there is no definite capacity to establish one thing.

original: gal te ci rung rung rjes su sgrub pas 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yin na ci chad ce na /
analyzed: gal te ci rung rung rjes su sgrub pas 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yin na ci chad ce na /
translated: But if one obtains the desired result by establishing anything at all, what is the point?

original: smras pa / gang yang rung ba nan du byas pa na /
analyzed: smras pa / gang yang rung ba nan du byas pa na /
translated: We say: If one insists on anything at all,

original: rnam par ci ltar yang rung ba sgrub pa tsam ste de kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par ci ltar yang rung ba sgrub pa tsam ste de kho na'o //
translated: it is merely the establishment of anything at all, that’s all.

original: de la don 'grub par khas len pa yin na /
analyzed: de la don 'grub par khas len pa yin na /
translated: If one accepts that the goal is accomplished in that way,

original: bstan bcos don med do //🔽'on te des nye bar bstan pa nyid la zhugs na 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos don med do // 'on te des nye bar bstan pa nyid la zhugs na 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: then the treatise is pointless.🔽But if one engages in what is taught by the treatise, then the result is accomplished.

original: bstan bcos byas pa la dgos pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos byas pa la dgos pa yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the composition of the treatise has a purpose.

original: de ltar ma yin no zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin no zhes smras pa ni /
translated: If you say that this is not so,

original: rang dgar rjes su sgrub pa la yang ngo zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang dgar rjes su sgrub pa la yang ngo zhes smos so //
translated: then you are also proving what is already established for us.

original: gang gi tshe bstan bcos kyis bstan pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa rjes su bsgrub pas kyang 'bras bu ster na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bstan bcos kyis bstan pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa rjes su bsgrub pas kyang 'bras bu ster na /
translated: If you give a result by proving what is not established by the treatise,

original: de'i tshe rang dga' dang khyad ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang dga' dang khyad ci zhig yod /
translated: then what is the difference between that and what you want?

original: de lta yin na ni rtsod pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rtsod pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, there would be no debate,

original: rtsed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because there would be no dispute.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore is a conclusion.

original: 'chad pa po ni byed pa po'i byed pa ni ston par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa po ni byed pa po'i byed pa ni ston par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The speaker is the agent. The agent's action is what is intended to be taught.

original: gtsor bya ba'i don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gtsor bya ba'i don brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the primary purpose is stated.

original: don gyi de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not the reason for the reality of the meaning.

original: 'di nyid du gal te smra ba po thams cad rig pa ma yin na zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid du gal te smra ba po thams cad rig pa ma yin na zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Here, if it is desired to say if the speaker is not omniscient, this is the remainder.

original: 'dir yang yon gnas phun sum tshogs pa 'am zhes lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang yon gnas phun sum tshogs pa 'am zhes lta ste /
translated: Here also, it is seen as if the recipient of offerings is perfect.

original: gal te yon tan 'di gnyis dang ldan na de'i tshe don gyi de kho na'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma nyid bzlog tu med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te yon tan 'di gnyis dang ldan na de'i tshe don gyi de kho na'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma nyid bzlog tu med pa kho na'o //
translated: If it had these two qualities, then the valid cognition of the reason of the reality of the object would be irresistible.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa de lta bu ni nges par mi nus pas na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa de lta bu ni nges par mi nus pas na'o //
translated: However, it is not possible to ascertain such a form.

original: de lta na yang bstan bcos la tshad mar nges pa ma yin no zhes 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang bstan bcos la tshad mar nges pa ma yin no zhes 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is argued that it is not ascertained as valid with respect to the treatise.

original: de ltar ston pa po las byung ba'i nyes pa brjod nas /🔽skyes bus ma byas par brtags pa la yang /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa po las byung ba'i nyes pa brjod nas / skyes bus ma byas par brtags pa la yang /
translated: Having stated the faults arising from the teacher,🔽he applies the same verse to the examination of the non-human composition,

original: nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni lung skyes bus ma byas par rtogs pa la yang tshigs su bcad pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa de nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni lung skyes bus ma byas par rtogs pa la yang tshigs su bcad pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: in order to state the faults. The meaning of the verse is this:

original: don gang blo la rab gsal pa //
analyzed: don gang blo la rab gsal pa //
translated: The meaning that is very clear to the mind,

original: @227a * // de la sgra ni tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: @227a * // de la sgra ni tshad ma nyid yin te /
translated: with respect to that, the word is valid cognition itself.

original: 'bras bu yin yang de la nus pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin yang de la nus pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though it is a result, it is because there is no obstruction to its potency.

original: shes pa ma skyes pa na tshad ma'i yul spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ma skyes pa na tshad ma'i yul spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when cognition has not yet arisen, there is no engagement of the object of valid cognition.

original: gang gi tshe de la tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de la tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: When is it a valid cognition?

original: gang gi tshe rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When it is itself, etc.

original: gang gi tshe yid las skyes pa la sogs pa 'chad pa po las don rtogs pa zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yid las skyes pa la sogs pa 'chad pa po las don rtogs pa zhes 'brel te /
translated: When the meaning is understood from the expounder, such as Manasa, etc.,

original: de'i tshe ni 'chad pa po'i 'dod pa'i yul gyi don gang yin la sgra tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'chad pa po'i 'dod pa'i yul gyi don gang yin la sgra tshad ma yin te /
translated: then the sound is a valid cognition with regard to the meaning of the object that is intended by the expounder,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the effect.

original: gnyi ga la yang /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang /
translated: In both cases,

original: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
translated: the reality of the meaning is not caused.

original: zhes bya ba rnam 'grel las brjod pa ni gtser bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam 'grel las brjod pa ni gtser bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is stated in the Pramānﬁ avārtika, and it is to be emphasized.

original: phyogs gnyi ga la yang rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i don nyid sgra las byung ba'i rtog pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga la yang rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i don nyid sgra las byung ba'i rtog pa'i yul yin no //
translated: In both cases, the reality of the meaning is the object of the conception that arises from the sound.

original: byed pa po med pa'i phyir na rig byed la nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i phyir na rig byed la nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no agent, there is no teaching in the Vedas.

original: ci don 'di nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci don 'di nyid yin nam /
translated: Is the meaning just this,

original: 'on te gzhan 'ga' zhig gam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan 'ga' zhig gam /
translated: or is there some other meaning?

original: 'o na te ci yang med ces nges par mi nus pa'i phyir sgra don de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can tshad ma ga la yin /
analyzed: 'o na te ci yang med ces nges par mi nus pa'i phyir sgra don de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can tshad ma ga la yin /
translated: But since it is not possible to ascertain that nothing exists at all, how can the meaning of the word be the reason for a valid cognition?

original: smra ba po'i byed pa zhes bya ba 'di la gnas pa'i smra ba po'i sgra 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: smra ba po'i byed pa zhes bya ba 'di la gnas pa'i smra ba po'i sgra 'grel ba ni /
translated: The commentary on the words of the speaker in the phrase “the activity of the speaker” is

original: 'chad pa po nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa po nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: “the expounder himself.”

original: gal te sgra las byung ba rnam par rtog pa blo la phyi'i don nyid snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te sgra las byung ba rnam par rtog pa blo la phyi'i don nyid snang ba yin te /
translated: If it is said that the conceptual cognition that arises from the word appears as an external object,

original: phyi rol nyid du lhag par zhe na pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du lhag par zhe na pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is a superimposition of external reality,

original: don gang blo la snang ba de nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don gang blo la snang ba de nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that “the object that appears to cognition is itself . . .”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gal te phyi rol nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir na don gang blo la gsal ba de nyid don yin na de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i don mtha' dag ces bya ba la rtogs par sla'o //
