original: 'on te ma zhugs pa la nyam da ba mthong ba las yang na 'jug pa la 'bras bu khyad par can mthong ba las zhes phyogs gsum mo //
analyzed: 'on te ma zhugs pa la nyam da ba mthong ba las yang na 'jug pa la 'bras bu khyad par can mthong ba las zhes phyogs gsum mo //
translated: Or else, it is from seeing the result of the special path of insight, when one has not yet entered the path of insight.

original: de la dang po la ni nges par sbyor ba byed pa'i rig byed de las lta ba gzhan las gnas pa thams cad kyang 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dang po la ni nges par sbyor ba byed pa'i rig byed de las lta ba gzhan las gnas pa thams cad kyang 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first case, it would follow, absurdly, that all those who are abiding in other views would enter the path of insight, because they would have the karma of entering the path of insight.

original: de dngos yin phyir zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor ba byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //🔽nam mkha' gcig la go skabs 'byed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de dngos yin phyir zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor ba byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so // nam mkha' gcig la go skabs 'byed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because it is the actual path, that is, because it is by nature the path of preparation.

original: @229a * // gzhan la ma yin pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: @229a * // gzhan la ma yin pa ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for one who is in the sky to be the nature of one who is making room for another, but not for another.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sbyor bar byed pa ma yin par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sbyor bar byed pa ma yin par ro //
translated: Otherwise, that is, if he were not making room.

original: rtogs na ni zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis lta ba gzhan du gnas pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rtogs na ni zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis lta ba gzhan du gnas pa rnams kyis so //
translated: If he were to understand, that is, if those abiding in other views were to understand.

original: lta ba gzhan la gnas pa dang / rig byed du smra ba dag go rims bzhin du phyin ci log pa dang ma log pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: lta ba gzhan la gnas pa dang / rig byed du smra ba dag go rims bzhin du phyin ci log pa dang ma log pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa /
translated: and those who adhere to other views and those who advocate the Vedas, respectively.

original: gcig nyid phyin ci log yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa de sus byed de /
analyzed: gcig nyid phyin ci log yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa de sus byed de /
translated: Who makes the determination that only one is erroneous?

original: sus kyang bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sus kyang bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: No one can make it. This is the meaning.

original: nges pa med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: To clarify that there is no such determination, he says,

original: gal te phyin ci log pas ni zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te phyin ci log pas ni zhes bya ste /
translated: “If one were to say that only one is erroneous,

original: lta ba gzhan du gnas pa mi 'jug na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan du gnas pa mi 'jug na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: the remainder is that one who adheres to other views would not engage in error.

original: 'jug pa la yang zhes bya ba ni rig byed tshad mar smra ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jug pa la yang zhes bya ba ni rig byed tshad mar smra ba la yang ngo //
translated: Also, in engagement, that is, in the case of those who advocate the Vedas as valid,

original: 'di zhes bya ba lta ba gzhan du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba lta ba gzhan du gnas pa'o //
translated: this, that is, one who adheres to other views,🔽would also be without error.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la dpyod pa pa yang de'i phyogs su ltung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la dpyod pa pa yang de'i phyogs su ltung ba ste /
translated: Also, those who analyze fall into that position,

original: rig byed kyi phyogs su ltung bas so //
analyzed: rig byed kyi phyogs su ltung bas so //
translated: because they fall into the position of the Vedas.

original: de ltar nges sbyor gyis 'jug par khas blangs nas sun phyung ba brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar nges sbyor gyis 'jug par khas blangs nas sun phyung ba brjod do //
translated: Having thus accepted the engagement by way of the Vedic injunction, he states the refutation.

original: da ni nges sbyor gyis kyang mi 'jug go zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni nges sbyor gyis kyang mi 'jug go zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to show that one does not engage by way of the Vedic injunction, he says:

original: bdag nges par sbyor ro snyam pa tsam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag nges par sbyor ro snyam pa tsam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “The mere thought ‘I am engaged by the Vedic injunction’ . . .”

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: The second part of the verse is stated:

original: mnga' bdag gtum pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnga' bdag gtum pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The fierce lord . . . ” and so on.

original: gal te rig byed kyi nges sbyor gyis de lta bu nyid du 'jug mod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyi nges sbyor gyis de lta bu nyid du 'jug mod snyam na /
translated: If you think that one engages in that way by the Vedic injunction,

original: tshad ma gzhan las zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan las zhes smos so //
translated: he says, “by another valid cognition.

original: nges sbyor des mi 'jug na gzhan gyi tshe log par lhung ba tshad mas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges sbyor des mi 'jug na gzhan gyi tshe log par lhung ba tshad mas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ” If one does not engage by that injunction, then at another time one will fall into error, seeing what is not valid as valid.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba'i rig byed kyi nges sbyor las mi 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba'i rig byed kyi nges sbyor las mi 'jug pa la'o //
translated: “Here” refers to not engaging by the Vedic injunction.

original: tshad ma gzhan ni log par ltung ba'i sgrub byed do //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan ni log par ltung ba'i sgrub byed do //
translated: “Another valid cognition” is the proof of falling into error.

original: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
translated: “In that case” is the doubt of the other party.

original: gal te ma zhugs na log par ltung ba'i sgrub byed kyi tshad ma gzhan med pas mi 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te ma zhugs na log par ltung ba'i sgrub byed kyi tshad ma gzhan med pas mi 'jug na /
translated: If one does not enter, and there is no other valid cognition to establish the fall into error, then one does not enter.

original: de'i tshe nges par sbyor ba don med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe nges par sbyor ba don med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In that case, it is pointless to strive for certainty. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: des na ma zhugs na nyam nga ba mthong ngam ma mthong yang rung ste /
analyzed: des na ma zhugs na nyam nga ba mthong ngam ma mthong yang rung ste /
translated: Thus, whether or not one sees the danger of not entering,

original: de lta na gdon mi za bar 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na gdon mi za bar 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa yin no //
translated: in that case, one must certainly enter. This is the opinion of the other party.

original: de lta yin na rig byed nyid nan gyis 'jug byed yin par gnas pa na /
analyzed: de lta yin na rig byed nyid nan gyis 'jug byed yin par gnas pa na /
translated: If that is so, then the Veda itself is the compelling agent.

original: de las ni thams cad thal bar 'gyur ro zhes lan sngar brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las ni thams cad thal bar 'gyur ro zhes lan sngar brjod pa nyid do //
translated: In that case, everything would follow from it. This is the response that was given earlier.

original: 'on kyang lan gyi tshul gyis gzhan la bzhad gad byed pa ni med mod @229b skyon ci yod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang lan gyi tshul gyis gzhan la bzhad gad byed pa ni med mod @229b skyon ci yod ces bya ba ste /
translated: But in the manner of a response, he says, “What is the fault?”

original: tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i don med pa la de ltar khas blangs pa las ma gtogs pa ci yang byar med do snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽de ltar yang //
analyzed: tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i don med pa la de ltar khas blangs pa las ma gtogs pa ci yang byar med do snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽de ltar yang //
translated: The point is that, apart from accepting that there is no object that comes about through the power of valid cognition, there is nothing else to be done.

original: skyes bus byas pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa rnams la ni //
translated: But in the case of human products,

original: nyes pa yod med rtogs pa'i rigs //
analyzed: nyes pa yod med rtogs pa'i rigs //
translated: it is reasonable to determine whether there is a fault or not.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyod kyi lugs yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyod kyi lugs yin no //
translated: This is the way you should proceed.

original: des na 'di ni rang gsad pa'i phyir gshed byed slong ba yin no zhes bzhad gad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni rang gsad pa'i phyir gshed byed slong ba yin no zhes bzhad gad du byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is like summoning a demon in order to kill yourself.

original: gzhan dag dogs par byed pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag dogs par byed pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Others raise an objection: “Even in the case of what is not produced by a person . . .

original: don med na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: don med na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: ” The idea is that if there is no meaning, it would not be produced by a person.

original: lan ni 'di la tshad ma ci yang med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di la tshad ma ci yang med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, “There is no valid cognition at all in this case.”

original: skyes bus ma byas pa la don med pa ma yin 'thad do zhes bya ba 'di la'o //🔽de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa la don med pa ma yin 'thad do zhes bya ba 'di la'o // de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The idea is that it is not tenable that what is not produced by a person is meaningless.🔽“Because we do not see that . . . ”

original: don dang mi ldan pa ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: The idea is that we do not see that it is meaningless.

original: 'gal ba tshad mas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba tshad mas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because there is no valid cognition that ascertains a contradiction . . . ”

original: skyes bus ma byas pa gzhan ni med la yod kyang don med pa ma yin pas khyab pa ma grub po //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa gzhan ni med la yod kyang don med pa ma yin pas khyab pa ma grub po //
translated: There is no other that is not made by a person, and even if there were, it would not be purposeless. Therefore, the pervasion is not established.

original: nges sbyor tsam la 'jug na sgra gzhan smos pa don med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: nges sbyor tsam la 'jug na sgra gzhan smos pa don med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If one engages in mere connection, it is pointless to mention other words. This is shown by

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If, and so on.

original: don med pa ni dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don med pa ni dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The purposeless is without doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sbyin sreg gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the fire offering, and so on.

original: dogs pa gsum pa la lan smras pa ni /
analyzed: dogs pa gsum pa la lan smras pa ni /
translated: The answer to the third doubt is

original: 'o na ni 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is the result itself, and so on.

original: nges par sbyor bas ci bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges par sbyor bas ci bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the use of the connection? is

original: sbyin sreg gis shig ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gis shig ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By the fire offering, and so on.

original: rig byed don med pa can yin yang mi rigs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa nyid bzhin du don med pa la yang mi rigs pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rig byed don med pa can yin yang mi rigs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa nyid bzhin du don med pa la yang mi rigs pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Even if the Vedas are purposeless, there is no impropriety. This means that just as there is no connection, there is also no impropriety in purposelessness.

original: 'on kyang rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is reasonable, is the meaning.

original: yang chos kyi sgo nas brtags te /
analyzed: yang chos kyi sgo nas brtags te /
translated: Again, it is examined from the perspective of Dharma.

original: sun 'byin pa brjod pa nges par sbyar ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa brjod pa nges par sbyar ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: The person is the one who is definitely connected with the expression of refutation.

original: yul ni mchod sbyin no //
analyzed: yul ni mchod sbyin no //
translated: The object is the sacrifice.

original: nges sbyor byed po ni sgra ste 'di rnams gang rung gi zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nges sbyor byed po ni sgra ste 'di rnams gang rung gi zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: The one who connects is the word. The rest is “any of these.”

original: de'i tshe thams cad la zhes bya ba nges par sbyar bya la sogs pa gang rung gi chos la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad la zhes bya ba nges par sbyar bya la sogs pa gang rung gi chos la'o //
translated: At that time, “all” is definitely connected to the one who connects and so on, any of the properties.

original: bshad pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The one who clarifies through explanation

original: nges par sbyor ba snam bu la sogs pa'i don bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba snam bu la sogs pa'i don bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is like the meaning of “cloth” and so on that is connected.

original: gal te mchod sbyin gyi bya ba las dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te mchod sbyin gyi bya ba las dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the sacrifice is the object of the action because it has action,

original: byed pa po dang las kyi chos su @230a * //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las kyi chos su @230a * //
translated: then the person and the action are the properties of the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis rigs kyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis rigs kyi /
translated: The two are conceptualized.

original: yul gyi chos rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi chos rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The object is conceptualized as a property.

original: ci ltar zhe na bden te nye ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na bden te nye ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is that? It is true, because there is a specific difference.

original: gal te gzhan dag nges sbyar ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag nges sbyar ni /
translated: If others are connected,

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa yul nyid kyi chos 'ga' zhig yin no zhes smra na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa gnyis sun phyung yang dogs pa mi ldog pa des na rnam par rtog pa gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa yul nyid kyi chos 'ga' zhig yin no zhes smra na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa gnyis sun phyung yang dogs pa mi ldog pa des na rnam par rtog pa gsum pa yin te /
translated: If one says that the object of the action is a dharma such as sacrifice, then even though two concepts are refuted, doubt is not eliminated, so there is a third concept.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni dngos po ci lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni dngos po ci lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
translated: All concepts are not as they are in reality.

original: nges par sbyar bya la sogs pa kho na'i chos yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: nges par sbyar bya la sogs pa kho na'i chos yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the object of the action is only the dharma of the action itself?

original: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in “In that regard, this . . .”

original: de la re zhig nges sbyor nges par sbyar bya'i chos yin pa sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig nges sbyor nges par sbyar bya'i chos yin pa sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: In that regard, first the refutation of the thesis that the object of the action is the dharma of the action itself is stated:

original: de ni sbyar bya'i chos yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sbyar bya'i chos yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: “It is the dharma of the object of the action.”

original: rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin gyis nges sbyor nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin gyis nges sbyor nyid yin no //
translated: The object of the action is the nature of the thing to be accomplished.

original: grub pa ni nges par sbyar bya ma yin pas nges par sbyar bya skyes bu bzhin du de'i chos kyang grub pa'i phyir na rjes su bsgrub bya nyid du ga las 'gyur /
analyzed: grub pa ni nges par sbyar bya ma yin pas nges par sbyar bya skyes bu bzhin du de'i chos kyang grub pa'i phyir na rjes su bsgrub bya nyid du ga las 'gyur /
translated: Since the established is not necessarily that which is to be accomplished, how could it be the case that it is the subsequent object to be accomplished, like a person who is to be accomplished, since its property is established?

original: de nyid gnyis su rnam par brtags nas sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su rnam par brtags nas sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the two alternatives that are imagined is

original: rjes su sgrub pas nges par sbyar bya de la'o //
analyzed: rjes su sgrub pas nges par sbyar bya de la'o //
translated: in regard to that which is to be accomplished by the subsequent.

original: bya ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The difference in action is the difference in the produced.

original: yod pa la chos gzhan sgrub na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa la chos gzhan sgrub na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if an existent is accomplished by another property.

original: yongs su grub zin pa la zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis skyes pa la'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub zin pa la zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis skyes pa la'o //
translated: That which is already fully established is that which has arisen by its own nature.

original: bya ba 'du byed gzhan gyis byed na don gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba 'du byed gzhan gyis byed na don gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the action is performed by another compositional factor, it would be a different object.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa zlog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa zlog par byed pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the second conception is

original: rang gi ngo bo sgrub pa ni zhes ya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo sgrub pa ni zhes ya ba'o //
translated: in regard to the establishment of its own nature.

original: 'gal ba ni nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni nyams pa'o //
translated: Contradiction is impairment.

original: gal te sgrub pa la rang bzhin gzhan byed na ci 'ga' la zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa la rang bzhin gzhan byed na ci 'ga' la zhe na /
translated: If one were to make an existent thing have a different nature, what would be the point?

original: grub zin pa la ma grub pa gzhan ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: grub zin pa la ma grub pa gzhan ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “A non-existent thing cannot be made to have the nature of an existent thing.”

original: ci'i phyir grub pa la grub pa'i rang bzhin mi rung ste zhe na /🔽gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir grub pa la grub pa'i rang bzhin mi rung ste zhe na / gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Why is it not possible for an existent thing to have the nature of an existent thing?🔽He says, “If it were to have the nature of that, it would not be that.”

original: de de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni de kho na de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes nges par gzung ba gtsor byed pa'i des na de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de de'i rang bzhin yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni de kho na de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes nges par gzung ba gtsor byed pa'i des na de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means that if it were to have the nature of that, it would not be that.

original: de'i rang bzhin du dmigs pas khyab po zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du dmigs pas khyab po zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is to say that if it were to be observed to have the nature of that, it would be that.

original: des na grub pa lam grub pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa nyid zlog pa na de'i rang bzhin yin pa sel ba yin no //🔽ma grub par dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: des na grub pa lam grub pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa nyid zlog pa na de'i rang bzhin yin pa sel ba yin no // ma grub par dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Thus, when one rejects the observation of an existent thing as having the nature of an existent thing, one rejects that it has the nature of that.🔽He says, “It is not possible to make a non-existent thing have the nature of an existent thing.”

original: @230b phyis dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //🔽'di snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: @230b phyis dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //🔽'di snyam du bsams pa yin te /
translated: He means to say that it is not possible to make a non-existent thing have the nature of an existent thing.🔽He says, “If it were to have the nature of that, it would not be that.”

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du nam yang ma dmigs pa de de'i rang bzhin ma yin mod /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du nam yang ma dmigs pa de de'i rang bzhin ma yin mod /
translated: That which is never observed as the intrinsic nature of something is indeed not its intrinsic nature.

original: grub pa ni ma grub pa'i rang bzhin du phyis dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: grub pa ni ma grub pa'i rang bzhin du phyis dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ro //
translated: But it is possible that what is established is observed later as the intrinsic nature of what is not established.

original: de'i zhes bya ba grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bor ro //
translated: “ That” refers to the intrinsic nature of what is established.

original: phyis dmigs nus pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyis dmigs nus pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ It is not possible to observe later”

original: ma grub par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: ma grub par 'dod pa ste /
translated: means that it is not accepted as not established.

original: de'i tshe grub ba zin pa 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe grub ba zin pa 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time what is established has already ceased.

original: phyis kyi dus la ltos nas da lta bar ni ma grub par 'dod pa ma mngon sum gyi blo 'dzin mod kyi /
analyzed: phyis kyi dus la ltos nas da lta bar ni ma grub par 'dod pa ma mngon sum gyi blo 'dzin mod kyi /
translated: It is not accepted that what is not established is observed by the cognition of direct perception in dependence on the later time as present.

original: 'das pa'i rang bzhin dang gcig pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i rang bzhin dang gcig pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the same as the intrinsic nature of what is past.

original: de bzhin du da lta bar 'dzin pas kyang 'byung ba dang lhan cig mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin du da lta bar 'dzin pas kyang 'byung ba dang lhan cig mi 'dzin to //
translated: In the same way, what is present is not observed together with what is future by the cognition that apprehends what is present.

original: 'di ga las she na mngon sum da lta'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na mngon sum da lta'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Why is this? “ The intrinsic nature of what is present is not the intrinsic nature of what is future.”

original: da lta'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: da lta'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the nature of the present” and so on is an explanation.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig mar gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the nature of the prior and subsequent” refers to the prior and subsequent moments.

original: gang gi phyir snga ma dang phi ma'i rang bzhin mthong ba mi nus pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snga ma dang phi ma'i rang bzhin mthong ba mi nus pa des na /
translated: Since the nature of the prior and subsequent cannot be seen,

original: dbang po las skyes shes pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang lhan cig gcig tu rig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes shes pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang lhan cig gcig tu rig pa ma yin la /
translated: the consciousness that arises from the sense faculty is not aware of the prior and subsequent as being one.

original: phyi ma 'das pa dang lhan cig tu rig pa yang ma yin no zhes sbyar ro ;
analyzed: phyi ma 'das pa dang lhan cig tu rig pa yang ma yin no zhes sbyar ro ;
translated: Nor is it aware of the subsequent as being one with the past.

original: / ci'i phyir mngon sum gyis gcig tu mi rig ce na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir mngon sum gyis gcig tu mi rig ce na /
translated: Why is it that direct perception is not aware of them as being one?

original: dbang po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir na zhes gsungs te /
translated: The root text states, “Because it follows the sense faculty.”

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba dag la dbang po mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba dag la dbang po mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the sense faculty does not engage with the primary elements and the derivative form,

original: dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not follow the sense faculty.

original: des na de dag gis mngon sum gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: des na de dag gis mngon sum gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, they are not directly perceived as being one.

original: / dbang po byed pa med par ni 'das pa la sogs pa mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin te /🔽da ltar ba dang 'brel ba ni //
analyzed: / dbang po byed pa med par ni 'das pa la sogs pa mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin te / da ltar ba dang 'brel ba ni //
translated: The sense faculties do not perceive past, etc., objects without activity.

original: mig sogs dag gis 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: mig sogs dag gis 'dzin pa yin //
translated: The present is connected with the eye, etc.🔽and is apprehended by them.

original: zhes bya ba gzhan gyi yang grub mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gzhan gyi yang grub mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the tenet of others.🔽Therefore, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: is a conclusion.

original: phyogs gnyis pa spong ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa spong ba ni /
translated: The second alternative is rejected:

original: nges sbyor yul gyi chos yin na yang zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: nges sbyor yul gyi chos yin na yang zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Even if the object is a quality of conjunction,🔽How is that?

original: de ci ltar zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor de nge ltar zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni rjes su sgrub pa'i yul nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci ltar zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor de nge ltar zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni rjes su sgrub pa'i yul nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on this “How is that?” is “because it is the object of inference.”

original: sgra rnams kyi rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du mi ston pa 'di ni don dam par yin te lhag par zhen @231a * //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du mi ston pa 'di ni don dam par yin te lhag par zhen @231a * //
translated: The statement that the words do not indicate the nature of the object to be inferred is from the ultimate point of view.

original: pas de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: pas de bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement of that is

original: dmigs pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: only nonapprehension.

original: mtha' gcig tu nges pa'i phyogs nyid la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin no snyam pas /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu nges pa'i phyogs nyid la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin no snyam pas /
translated: Therefore, this fault is incurred only by those who maintain a definite position.

original: gzhan dag smra ba ni rang bzhin 'ga' ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag smra ba ni rang bzhin 'ga' ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others say: “The nature of something is its own nature.

original: des sbyor ni rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin zhing de la yod pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des sbyor ni rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin zhing de la yod pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: The nature of something is merely the nature that is understood when it is cognized.

original: de yang mi rigs te dngos po cha med pa la dum bur rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la na gzhan nas sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te dngos po cha med pa la dum bur rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la na gzhan nas sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: That is not correct, because it is not tenable that a partless thing is cognized in parts.”

original: de ni ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: To respond to that, he says, “That is not so.”

original: ngo bo zhes bya ba spyir bstan pa ni nges sbyor gyi mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo zhes bya ba spyir bstan pa ni nges sbyor gyi mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: The general statement “nature” is the final conclusion of the syllogism.

original: ngo bo des nges sbyor ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo des nges sbyor ma yin no //
translated: The nature of something is not the syllogism.

original: gang gis de ni yod min pa //
analyzed: gang gis de ni yod min pa //
translated: “By what does it exist?”

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the second position.

original: nyes pa snga ma las mi 'grel lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyes pa snga ma las mi 'grel lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it does not escape the previous fault.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod par 'dod pas /
translated: The other refutation is stated by one who wishes to state the other's position,

original: rang nyid kyis gzhan gyi smra ba gsal bar byed pa smras pa ni /🔽de yi rtogs bzhin nyid grub cing //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis gzhan gyi smra ba gsal bar byed pa smras pa ni / de yi rtogs bzhin nyid grub cing //
translated: and it is stated in order to clarify the other's position.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement the nature of that which is being cognized is established and so forth.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor gyi'o //
translated: The word that refers to the ascertainment.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: The refutation is stated:

original: de yi rang gi ngo bo ni //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yi rang gi ngo bo ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of that which is being cognized is established.

original: nges sbyor de'i rang bzhin rjes su bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: nges sbyor de'i rang bzhin rjes su bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of that ascertainment is what is to be established.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin na /
translated: If it were otherwise, that is, if it were not the nature of what is to be established,

original: nges sbyor nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges sbyor nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be an ascertainment.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni //
translated: This is clarified:

original: rtogs bzhin pa nyid tsam zhig ni //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa nyid tsam zhig ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mere fact of being cognized and so forth.

original: de zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor ro //
translated: The word that refers to the ascertainment.

original: de lta min na min zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de lta min na min zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: Otherwise, that is, if it were not so, it would not be an ascertainment. This is the meaning of it would not be.

original: / rjes su bsgrub bya nyid nges sbyor gyi bsgrub bya byed pa yin no zhes bstan nas yang de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes so //
analyzed: / rjes su bsgrub bya nyid nges sbyor gyi bsgrub bya byed pa yin no zhes bstan nas yang de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes so //
translated: The object of proof is the probandum of the proof. Having taught that, in order to teach that again, he says “if” .

original: de la zhes bya ba ni yul la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni yul la'o //
translated: “In that” means in the object.

original: rjes su sgrub par snang ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su sgrub par snang ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Appears as the proof” means

original: nges sbyor gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nges sbyor gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the definition of the proof.

original: gzhan min zhes bya ba rjes su bsgrub bya ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan min zhes bya ba rjes su bsgrub bya ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: “Not other” means not the probandum.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: rjes su bsgrub bya nyid ni ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pa tsam gyis ngon 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub bya nyid ni ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pa tsam gyis ngon 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The probandum is not established by the mere exclusion of non-connection.

original: 'on kyang gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas so //
translated: Rather, it is by the exclusion of connection with other.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su bsgrub bya ma yin pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs @231b nas ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su bsgrub bya ma yin pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs @231b nas ;
translated: Otherwise, following the non-probandum,

original: rjes su bsgrub bya ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub bya ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: it would also be the non-probandum.

original: des na nges sbyor ni yul gyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nges sbyor ni yul gyi chos ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the proof is not a property of the object.

original: spyi rig pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'thad pa brjod pa'i don du rtogs bzhin pa nyid tsam zhig ni zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa nyid dran par byed pa yin no //🔽de nyid bshad pa ni spyi rig yin na de la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi rig pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'thad pa brjod pa'i don du rtogs bzhin pa nyid tsam zhig ni zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa nyid dran par byed pa yin no // de nyid bshad pa ni spyi rig yin na de la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This not in general reminds us of the earlier explanation, merely the state of being cognized.🔽 The explanation of that is if it were in general.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni spyi rig yin zhes bya ba dang gzhi mthun pa'i bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni spyi rig yin zhes bya ba dang gzhi mthun pa'i bdun pa'o //
translated: The if it were is a relative pronoun referring to in general.

original: gang gi phyir mchod sbyin la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub par bya ba'i don rig pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mchod sbyin la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub par bya ba'i don rig pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is because it is not the cognition of the meaning to be accomplished, such as the sacrifice, etc.

original: der smra ba'i nges sbyor ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: der smra ba'i nges sbyor ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The conclusion is the assertion of that, etc.

original: 'di yang de'i phyir zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang de'i phyir zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be seen as for that reason.

original: der smra ba'i zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor ngag gi don du smra ba'i 'dod pa la nges sbyor ngag gi don yin pa der mi 'gyur te /🔽'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der smra ba'i zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor ngag gi don du smra ba'i 'dod pa la nges sbyor ngag gi don yin pa der mi 'gyur te /🔽'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: The assertion of that is not the meaning of the assertion, because it is not proper.

original: 'di spang ba'i don du gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di spang ba'i don du gal te zhes smos so //
translated: In order to refute this, he says, If...

original: gang 'di'i don ni 'di yin gyi 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rtogs par yod pa dang med pa nges par byed pa nyid la /
analyzed: gang 'di'i don ni 'di yin gyi 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rtogs par yod pa dang med pa nges par byed pa nyid la /
translated: The meaning of this is, This is the meaning of this, but it is not this, and in this, there is the ascertainment of the existence and non-existence of understanding.

original: rtogs pa de yang yod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa de yang yod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: And that understanding is also existent, he thinks.

original: nges par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa gsum gyis phye ba'i nges sbyor gyi rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa gsum gyis phye ba'i nges sbyor gyi rtogs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the compound one who is engaged in ascertainment is that it is a compound of three understandings: engagement, ascertainment, and so on.

original: gcig kyang 'god pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gcig kyang 'god pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: And one of those understandings is engaged, is the meaning of the compound.

original: ci'i phyir skyes bu nges par sbyor ba por mi 'dod ces dogs pa na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyes bu nges par sbyor ba por mi 'dod ces dogs pa na /
translated: Why is it not accepted that the person is the one who engages?

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
translated: To this, another says,

original: rig byed kyi skyes bu la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi skyes bu la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition of the Vedic person.

original: rig byed byed pa'i skyes bu gang yin de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed byed pa'i skyes bu gang yin de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition of the person who performs the Veda.

original: de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan smras pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan smras pa ste /
translated: That is not correct, and so on is the response.

original: gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It is not established that there is not even one” means that it is not established that there is not even one existent.

original: 'di ltar gal te nges par sbyar bar bya ba dang / nges par sbyor bar byed pa po dag gi rtogs pa yod du chug la de lta na yang yul mchod sbyin gyi rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te nges par sbyar bar bya ba dang / nges par sbyor bar byed pa po dag gi rtogs pa yod du chug la de lta na yang yul mchod sbyin gyi rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, even if the object of expression and the one who expresses it exist, the object of expression, the sacrifice, does not exist,

original: de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it does not exist.

original: re zhig rtogs pa ni yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig rtogs pa ni yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of expression exists,

original: gal te gang zhig rtogs par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa med na /
analyzed: gal te gang zhig rtogs par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa med na /
translated: if the object of expression does not exist,

original: der rang gi rang bzhin rig pa yin /🔽rig pa yod do zhe na ni rang gi ngo bo sus 'gog ces brjod pa ni /
analyzed: der rang gi rang bzhin rig pa yin / rig pa yod do zhe na ni rang gi ngo bo sus 'gog ces brjod pa ni /
translated: then it is the awareness of its own nature.

original: gang zhig rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: If you say that awareness exists, who is it that refutes its own nature?

original: zhes bya ba @232a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba @232a * //
translated: This is what is said in the line:🔽“If it does not exist by its own nature . . .”

original: la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de'i rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i rig pas kyang gal te rig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i rig pas kyang gal te rig pa yin na ni /
translated: If awareness is awareness even without contacting its nature,

original: thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: then everything would be aware of everything.

original: de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa kho na de rig pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa kho na de rig pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The nature of that is directly perceived, and that is cognition.

original: rang gi ngo bo med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is explained in “If it has no intrinsic reality . . . ” and so on.

original: de yang med la rang gi rang bzhin rig par 'gyur mod 'di la yod ce na /
analyzed: de yang med la rang gi rang bzhin rig par 'gyur mod 'di la yod ce na /
translated: And if that does not exist, then its intrinsic reality would be cognized.

original: dmigs par byed pa dang dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin brjod nas /
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa dang dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the nature of the object of perception and the perceiver,

original: yod pa bsgrub par dmigs pa yod pa nges par brjod do //
analyzed: yod pa bsgrub par dmigs pa yod pa nges par brjod do //
translated: he concludes that the object of perception exists.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: And because that is so,

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa brjod pa yin la /
translated: “object of perception” means “exists.”

original: de yang med pa'i phyir na 'gal lo //
analyzed: de yang med pa'i phyir na 'gal lo //
translated: And because that does not exist, there is a contradiction.

original: gang gis dmigs pa shes pa yin pa de'i tshe yang yod pa zhes bya ba yod pa'i tha snyad la nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis dmigs pa shes pa yin pa de'i tshe yang yod pa zhes bya ba yod pa'i tha snyad la nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And when the object of perception is cognized, then “exists” is ascertained, meaning that the convention of existence is ascertained.

original: zla ba gnyis kyis 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyis 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the error of two moons is the object of perception.

original: der gang zhig dmigs pa dmigs pa rang gi rnam pa de ni yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: der gang zhig dmigs pa dmigs pa rang gi rnam pa de ni yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: Whatever is perceived there, the form of the object of perception, that exists.

original: gang zhig de med pa'i phyi rol gyi zla ba gnyis po de ni dgag par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig de med pa'i phyi rol gyi zla ba gnyis po de ni dgag par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two external moons, which are not like that, are not to be refuted.

original: 'gog na yang gzhal bya med kyang tshad mar 'gyur pas tshad ma la gus pa thag ring du spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog na yang gzhal bya med kyang tshad mar 'gyur pas tshad ma la gus pa thag ring du spangs pa nyid do //
translated: And if you do refute them, then even without an object of comprehension, there would be a valid cognition, and so you would be abandoning respect for valid cognition far away.

original: 'jig rten ni dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir na snang bzhin pa nyid la rtag par bsams nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir na snang bzhin pa nyid la rtag par bsams nas /
translated: Because the world is free from analysis, it thinks that what appears is permanent.

original: gang zhig snang ba de nyid med do zhes 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig zad la 'khrul pa rnam par gzhag pa yang de la ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig snang ba de nyid med do zhes 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig zad la 'khrul pa rnam par gzhag pa yang de la ltos pa nyid do //
translated: And so, when something appears, it thinks that it exists.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the object of observation itself exists,

original: dmigs pa tsam nyid kyis yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur gyi gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam nyid kyis yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur gyi gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the mere object of observation is the convention of existence, and it is not dependent on anything else. This is the meaning.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo dngos su rtogs par khas blangs na 'di 'gal ba yin na 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo dngos su rtogs par khas blangs na 'di 'gal ba yin na 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin te /
translated: If you accept that the object’s own nature is directly realized, then this is contradictory. But this is just a realization.

original: rang gi ngo bo mngon du ma byas par rang gi ngo bor zhen pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba ga las 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dogs pa tsam la brten nas mdun gyi rtsod pa la 'jug pa'i bsam pas dmigs pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mngon du ma byas par rang gi ngo bor zhen pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba ga las 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dogs pa tsam la brten nas mdun gyi rtsod pa la 'jug pa'i bsam pas dmigs pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mere thought of engaging in the debate in front, based on the mere doubt, is stated as “the mere observation.”

original: yod ces bya bar rtogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba yod ces bya bar ngas pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: yod ces bya bar rtogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba yod ces bya bar ngas pa yin pa'o //
translated: “It is not the realization that it exists” means that it is the realization that it does not exist.

original: dper na rtogs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du rtogs pa tsam yin pa nyid kyi phyir @232b yul gyi chos can yod pa nye bar brjod pa ma yin na de'i chos nges sbyor lta smos kyang ci dgos des na rtogs pa dmigs
analyzed: dper na rtogs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du rtogs pa tsam yin pa nyid kyi phyir @232b yul gyi chos can yod pa nye bar brjod pa ma yin na de'i chos nges sbyor lta smos kyang ci dgos des na rtogs pa dmigs
translated: Just as there is no contradiction because it is a mere realization, in the same way, since it is a mere realization, the existence of the property of the subject is not stated, so what need is there to mention the property of that?

original: pa med pa nyid mi spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa med pa nyid mi spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “the mere observation is not refuted” is that the mere observation is not refuted.

original: gal te rtogs pa tsam gyis kyang yod /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa tsam gyis kyang yod /
translated: If the mere observation is also existent,

original: nges par byed mod cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nges par byed mod cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what is the point of ascertaining it?

original: lung rnams la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lung rnams la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is “The scriptures say…”

original: gal te rtogs so cog gis don gnas na de'i tshe lung la brten nas chos can gcig kho na la phan tshun 'gal ba de kho na la mngon par zhen pa'i blo sna tshogs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rtogs so cog gis don gnas na de'i tshe lung la brten nas chos can gcig kho na la phan tshun 'gal ba de kho na la mngon par zhen pa'i blo sna tshogs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: If all of the various understandings had a basis in fact, then at that time, in dependence on scripture, the various understandings that are fixated on mutually contradictory things with regard to a single basis would not occur.

original: gcig la 'gal ba de kho na du ma nye bar 'jog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig la 'gal ba de kho na du ma nye bar 'jog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not tenable to posit a multiplicity of mutually contradictory things with regard to a single basis.

original: blo gcig po 'ga' zhig lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo gcig po 'ga' zhig lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Only a single understanding would remain.

original: de kho na sna tshogs su mngon par zhen pa lung la brten pa'i blo yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na sna tshogs su mngon par zhen pa lung la brten pa'i blo yang yod pa yin no //
translated: And the various understandings that are fixated on reality in dependence on scripture would not exist.

original: de'i phyir rtogs so cog gis don gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs so cog gis don gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of the various understandings do not have a basis in fact.

original: rgyu'i dri mas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dri mas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the stain of the cause” refers to the statements of others.

original: rgyu byed pa po'i nyes pa chags pa la sogs pa des sbags pa ni skyes bu'i lung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu byed pa po'i nyes pa chags pa la sogs pa des sbags pa ni skyes bu'i lung ngo //
translated: The statements of persons are stained by the faults of the creator, such as attachment.

original: de las bzlog pa rig byed las gtogs pa ni don gyi gzhan dbang nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rig byed las gtogs pa ni don gyi gzhan dbang nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opposite of that is the statements of the Vedas. This is the meaning of the phrase “the power of the object.”

original: min zhes bya ba ni dgag pa po'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ni /
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni dgag pa po'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ni /
translated: The word “not” indicates the reason for the denial.

original: 'jig rten rjes 'brangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten rjes 'brangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: The phrase “because of following the world” indicates the reason.

original: ci ltar na rig byed las 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs pa kho nas rtogs she na /🔽sgra don 'jig rten na srid phyir //
analyzed: ci ltar na rig byed las 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs pa kho nas rtogs she na / sgra don 'jig rten na srid phyir //
translated: How is it that one understands the meaning of the Veda only by following the world?

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: Because the relation between the word and its meaning is possible in the world.

original: sgra dang don dag gnas las lhung bar 'dod pa ni 'ga' na yang med do //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gnas las lhung bar 'dod pa ni 'ga' na yang med do //
translated: No one holds that the relation between the word and its meaning is innate or is created by God or is created by oneself.

original: de dag 'jig rten na srid pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten na srid pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it possible in the world?

original: 'jig rten mchod sbyin la sogs pa dmigs pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten mchod sbyin la sogs pa dmigs pas so //
translated: Because the world perceives sacrifice, etc.

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i sgra ni rjod byed dang mar blugs pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i sgra ni rjod byed dang mar blugs pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ni /
translated: The word “sacrifice,” etc., is the means of expression, and the pouring of clarified butter, etc., is the object of expression.

original: 'jig rten nyid na dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyid na dmigs pa yin no //
translated: These are perceived in the world itself.

original: des na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad sngon mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis sgra don phyis gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad sngon mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis sgra don phyis gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation between the word and its meaning is established later by following the conventions of the world that were seen previously.

original: de las skabs la cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las skabs la cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does this have to do with the present discussion?

original: sngon mthong zhes smos so //
analyzed: sngon mthong zhes smos so //
translated: The word “previously” is used because the Vedas were seen to be the source of knowledge in the past.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa'i sgra las rtogs pa don sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rig byed pa'i sgra las kyang /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa'i sgra las rtogs pa don sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rig byed pa'i sgra las kyang /
translated: Just as the words of worldly people are not a means of accomplishing the goal, so also the words of the Vedas are not.

original: 'dod chags las bslad pa'i 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs nas blo skye ba na don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags las bslad pa'i 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs nas blo skye ba na don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: When the mind arises in accordance with the world, which is corrupted by attachment, it is not a means of accomplishing the goal.

original: 'jig rten la ma ltos na ni @233a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten la ma ltos na ni @233a * //
translated: If it did not depend on the world,

original: rig byed las rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir mi srid pa'i mtshan nyid kho na tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rig byed las rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir mi srid pa'i mtshan nyid kho na tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: it would be impossible to understand the Vedas. Therefore, it would be a means of valid knowledge that has the characteristic of impossibility.

original: sngar shin tu cher goms pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas pa'i yid can dag blo gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong ngo zhes ston pa ni 'dod dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar shin tu cher goms pa'i bag chags kyi dbang du byas pa'i yid can dag blo gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong ngo zhes ston pa ni 'dod dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse “The mind of one who is under the power of predispositions that have been greatly cultivated in the past is seen to change” shows this.

original: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par mthong ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par mthong ba med do //
translated: The result of desire is not seen to be accomplished.🔽Or,

original: yang na / blo sngon rjes su 'brang ba ni //
analyzed: yang na / blo sngon rjes su 'brang ba ni //
translated: The mind that follows after

original: mthong ba 'dod pa'i sgrub byed min //
analyzed: mthong ba 'dod pa'i sgrub byed min //
translated: Is not a means of accomplishing what is seen to be desired.

original: sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be applied.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni ngag dang tshig don bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni ngag dang tshig don bya ba'o //
translated: Another way of stating this is that speech and words are the means of expression.

original: ngag dang tshig don nye bar bslad pa ni don gzhan la grags pa don gzhan la sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: ngag dang tshig don nye bar bslad pa ni don gzhan la grags pa don gzhan la sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The corruption of the means of expression, speech and words, is the application of a word known in one sense to another sense.

original: de la dus tha dad par go'i sgra'i don dgu la grags pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dus tha dad par go'i sgra'i don dgu la grags pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, the word go is known to have nine senses in different times.

original: da lta ni mda' la yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: da lta ni mda' la yang mthong ngo //
translated: Now it is seen in the sense of arrow.

original: yul tha dad par ni ka li dang ma ri la sogs pa'i sgra rtsod pa'i dus la sogs pa la grags pa gzhan du mi smyo ba la sogs pa la mthong ngo //🔽chig bslad na ni ngag bslad pa ni yang rnyed par sla ste /
analyzed: yul tha dad par ni ka li dang ma ri la sogs pa'i sgra rtsod pa'i dus la sogs pa la grags pa gzhan du mi smyo ba la sogs pa la mthong ngo // chig bslad na ni ngag bslad pa ni yang rnyed par sla ste /
translated: In different places, the word kali is known in the time of dispute and so on, but it is seen in another sense in the time of madness and so on.

original: de ni de tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is corrupted, then corrupted speech is easily recovered because it is a collection of those.

original: ci ltar 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs nas mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i don mar gyi sreg blugs la sogs pa la brtags pa de bzhin du sngar don gzhan la grags pa nyid da ltar don 'di brjod pa yin no zhes ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
analyzed: ci ltar 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brangs nas mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i don mar gyi sreg blugs la sogs pa la brtags pa de bzhin du sngar don gzhan la grags pa nyid da ltar don 'di brjod pa yin no zhes ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
translated: Just as you follow the world in examining the meaning of sacrifice, etc., in the sense of the offering of clarified butter, etc., why don’t you understand that the meaning of the Vedas is just the same as what is accepted by others?

original: 'dir gzhan gyis smras pa ni rig byed de la rmongs pa la sogs zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log la sogs pa bsams pa'i nyes pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis smras pa ni rig byed de la rmongs pa la sogs zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log la sogs pa bsams pa'i nyes pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Here, the opponent says: “There is no fault of error, etc. in the Vedas, because they are confused, etc.”

original: byed pa po'i med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po'i med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no agent.

original: sgra gang las byed pa po srid pa de la ni phyin ci log la sogs pa bsam pa nyes pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra gang las byed pa po srid pa de la ni phyin ci log la sogs pa bsam pa nyes pa yod pa yin no //
translated: In those scriptures where an agent is possible, there is the fault of error, etc. in the thought.

original: des na mi 'dod pa'i don la 'jug par dogs pas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'dod pa'i don la 'jug par dogs pas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the fear of engaging in an undesired meaning, they are not valid cognitions.

original: rig byed la ni de med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rig byed la ni de med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But because that is not the case with the Vedas, they are not invalid cognitions. This is the meaning.

original: lan du yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lan du yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response, he says, “Also, etc.”

original: rig byed kyi yul la ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa'i don rtogs pa med pa nyid kyis skyon 'ga' zhig ji ltar 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi yul la ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa'i don rtogs pa med pa nyid kyis skyon 'ga' zhig ji ltar 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: How could it be that the object of the Vedas is not understood, that is, that its meaning is not understood without error?

original: 'on kyang thams cad 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: But it is maintained that all of it is understood.

original: dper na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skyes bu'i chos gzhan du 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu'i chos yang dag par rtogs pa yang phyin ci @233b ma log par brjod pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skyes bu'i chos gzhan du 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu'i chos yang dag par rtogs pa yang phyin ci @233b ma log par brjod pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Just as such things as desire and hatred are the cause of a person engaging in other things, so too the understanding of a person’s dharma is the cause of the expression without error.

original: des na gal te rnam pa thams cad du skyes bu log na de'i tshe bden pa'i don nyid ma yin la log pa'i don yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gal te rnam pa thams cad du skyes bu log na de'i tshe bden pa'i don nyid ma yin la log pa'i don yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, if a person is completely mistaken, then at that time it is not the meaning of truth, nor is it the meaning of error.

original: 'on kyang rig byed don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rig byed don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it would be meaningless.

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pas bslad pa'i yid la skyes bu la sogs pas byas pa'i brda tsam gyis rjes su 'gro ba don du snang ba ni /
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pas bslad pa'i yid la skyes bu la sogs pas byas pa'i brda tsam gyis rjes su 'gro ba don du snang ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of meaning that is merely the sign made by a person, such as a person, that occurs in the mind polluted by desire and so on, is not the meaning of truth.

original: rtsva'i mtho yor la sogs pa bzhin du rig byed kyi ngag la tshad mar 'jog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsva'i mtho yor la sogs pa bzhin du rig byed kyi ngag la tshad mar 'jog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not like a scarecrow, etc., that is taken to be a valid cognition with regard to the words of the Vedas.

original: des na rig byed kyi ngag thos pa na don du snang ba ni /
analyzed: des na rig byed kyi ngag thos pa na don du snang ba ni /
translated: Therefore, when one hears the words of the Vedas, the appearance of meaning

original: rtsva'i mtho yor la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar bslad pas byas pa'i brda tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba ni tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva'i mtho yor la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar bslad pas byas pa'i brda tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba ni tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: is not a valid cognition that follows mere convention made by the corruption of attachment, etc., like a scarecrow, etc.

original: skyes bus byas pa bzhin du skyes bus ma byas pa yang bsam pa'i nyes bas dngos po dang / 'brel nyams pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa bzhin du skyes bus ma byas pa yang bsam pa'i nyes bas dngos po dang / 'brel nyams pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Just as a human product is not a valid cognition, so also a nonhuman product is not a valid cognition, because it is related to a faulty conception and is not related to a thing.

original: 'jig rten bsam pa'i nyes pa'i sa //
analyzed: 'jig rten bsam pa'i nyes pa'i sa //
translated: The verse “In the world, the words of the Vedas are not a valid cognition because of the fault of conception”

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽bsam pa'i nyes pas sgra tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // bsam pa'i nyes pas sgra tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: teaches this.🔽The words of the Vedas are not a valid cognition because of the fault of conception.

original: 'jig rten na gang brjod pa de ni dngos po dang 'brel pa nyams pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gang brjod pa de ni dngos po dang 'brel pa nyams pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: In the world, what is expressed is not related to a thing.

original: dngos po'i 'brel pa nyams pa 'di ni rig byed la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'brel pa nyams pa 'di ni rig byed la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is similar to the Vedas, because the connection with the thing is lost.

original: ci ltar rig byed tshad ma yin /
analyzed: ci ltar rig byed tshad ma yin /
translated: How are the Vedas valid?

original: gal te me la du ba bzhin du sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa dngos po nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te me la du ba bzhin du sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa dngos po nyid yin na /
translated: If the connection between words and meanings were a real thing, like smoke and fire,

original: de'i tshe skyes bu'i 'dod pas mi 'jug pa'i phyir sgra thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes bu'i 'dod pas mi 'jug pa'i phyir sgra thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then all words would be valid cognitions, because they would not be used according to people's wishes.

original: 'on te 'dod pa la rag las pa nyid bzlog tu med na 'o na ni 'brel pa dngos po pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa dang / ma byas pa dag la khyad par ci yod snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa la rag las pa nyid bzlog tu med na 'o na ni 'brel pa dngos po pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa dang / ma byas pa dag la khyad par ci yod snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: But if dependence on wishes is unavoidable, then what is the difference between what is made by people and what is not made by people, since the connection is not a real thing?

original: gal te 'jig rten nyid kyi ngag dang tshig don bslad par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten nyid kyi ngag dang tshig don bslad par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not seen that the speech and words of the world are corrupted,

original: de ji ltar de'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig byed la yang bslad pa srid do zhes brjod ces dogs na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig byed la yang bslad pa srid do zhes brjod ces dogs na /
translated: how can it be said that corruption is possible in the Vedas, following that?

original: ngag dang tshig don 'jig rten na //
analyzed: ngag dang tshig don 'jig rten na //
translated: Speech and words in the world

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: are not seen to be corrupted.

original: ngag dang tshig tu gyur pa'i sgra gang dag la don bslad pa mthong ba'i sgra de nyid rig byed la yang yin na /
analyzed: ngag dang tshig tu gyur pa'i sgra gang dag la don bslad pa mthong ba'i sgra de nyid rig byed la yang yin na /
translated: The sound that is a word or a phrase is the Veda itself, since the meaning of the sound is seen to be corrupted.

original: rig byed la yang ji ltar bslad pa mi srid /
analyzed: rig byed la yang ji ltar bslad pa mi srid /
translated: How could the Veda itself be corrupted?

original: de ltar rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa yin yang bslad pa srid pas bsad pa'i tshad ma nyid yang rnam pa gzhan gyis gso ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa yin yang bslad pa srid pas bsad pa'i tshad ma nyid yang rnam pa gzhan gyis gso ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, although the Veda is not created by a person, since corruption is possible, the validity of the Veda is established by another method.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa ni rig byed @234a * //🔽rang nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa ni rig byed @234a * // rang nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others say that the Veda is self-evident.

original: rang nyid mi 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang nyid mi 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said that it is not engaged by itself.

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa skyes bu'i don byed pa la mi ltos par rang nyid 'jug pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa skyes bu'i don byed pa la mi ltos par rang nyid 'jug pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not that the Veda itself is engaged without relying on a person who performs the purpose of a person, such as a sacrifice.

original: skyes bu yang rang nyid mchod sbyin la sogs pa rtogs par ci ltar nus /
analyzed: skyes bu yang rang nyid mchod sbyin la sogs pa rtogs par ci ltar nus /
translated: How could a person understand a sacrifice and so on by himself?

original: mi slu ba dang 'brel pa'i don can gyi rig byed kyis bskul na ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang 'brel pa'i don can gyi rig byed kyis bskul na ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Veda, which has a meaning that is related to nondeception, impels one, one engages in a sacrifice and so on.

original: des na rig byed tshad ma yin no zhes rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: des na rig byed tshad ma yin no zhes rigs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that the Vedas are valid.

original: lan 'di ni lung thams cad la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan 'di ni lung thams cad la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to this is, “All scriptures are like that.

original: 'dir rig byed la tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan lhan cig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: 'dir rig byed la tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan lhan cig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: Here, the reason that the Vedas are valid is that they exist simultaneously with the Vedas.

original: /'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni lung thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: /'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni lung thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the basis of the argument.

original: lus rnams la so sor nges pa'i don gang yin pa de dag gis nang gi rnam par dbye ba khyad par mchod sbyin dang / rnal 'byor dang / lhag par gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnams la so sor nges pa'i don gang yin pa de dag gis nang gi rnam par dbye ba khyad par mchod sbyin dang / rnal 'byor dang / lhag par gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning that is specific to the bodies is the internal divisions, such as the sacrifices, yoga, and the special observances.

original: skyes bu tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By mere person” means

original: gang gi tshe shin tu dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba yin na de'i tshe nus mod kyi 'on kyang rig byed kyang de ltar thal bas na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shin tu dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba yin na de'i tshe nus mod kyi 'on kyang rig byed kyang de ltar thal bas na /
translated: if it is seen that it is beyond the senses, then it is possible, but since the Vedas are also like that,

original: skyes bus ma byas par khas len pa legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas par khas len pa legs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not good to accept that they are not made by a person.

original: phyogs gzhan bshad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan bshad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other position is stated: “Or, the Vedas are not made by a person.”

original: dran par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de'i yul can gyi yid la byed pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dran par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de'i yul can gyi yid la byed pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: “It causes one to remember” means that the mental activity that has it as its object is engaged.

original: 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows:

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa dang / mtho ris la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba gnyis 'dir thob pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa dang / mtho ris la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba gnyis 'dir thob pa yin no //
translated: The two, the one who accomplishes the sacrifice, etc., and the one who accomplishes heaven, etc., are obtained here.

original: de la 'di ltar mchod sbyin bya'o zhes dgod pa tsam la ni thal ba yang nus pa nyams pa mad do //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar mchod sbyin bya'o zhes dgod pa tsam la ni thal ba yang nus pa nyams pa mad do //
translated: In that case, it is not the case that the potency of the reductio is lost in the mere statement, “The sacrifice, etc., should be performed in this way.”

original: de'i byed pa'i 'bras bu mtho ris yin no zhes bya bar nges na ni mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i byed pa'i 'bras bu mtho ris yin no zhes bya bar nges na ni mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were certain that heaven is the effect of its performance, then it would be impossible.

original: de'i 'bras bur brjod pa ni dgag par yang mi nus so //🔽des na na rmongs pas sam /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bur brjod pa ni dgag par yang mi nus so // des na na rmongs pas sam /
translated: And it is not possible to deny the statement that it is its effect.🔽Therefore, it is easy to say that it is not a valid cognition because it is confused,

original: bslu ba'i bsam pas brjod par sla zhing /
analyzed: bslu ba'i bsam pas brjod par sla zhing /
translated: or because it is said with the intention to deceive,

original: mi slu ba la nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa yang sla'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba la nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa yang sla'o //
translated: and because it is certain that it does not deceive.

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i don bya ba'i bdag nyid mtshungs pa de'i kun gyis byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po las 'das pa mthong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i don bya ba'i bdag nyid mtshungs pa de'i kun gyis byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po las 'das pa mthong bar byed pa'am /
translated: The self of the meaning of the action of sacrifice, etc. is not the same as that of the meaning of the action of seeing, etc.

original: phyogs gzhan la ni /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan la ni /
translated: but in another case,

original: spyod pa'i rang bzhin can sems ma yengs par byed pa de rig byed la yang mi mtshungs @234b sam ste /
analyzed: spyod pa'i rang bzhin can sems ma yengs par byed pa de rig byed la yang mi mtshungs @234b sam ste /
translated: the nature of the action of the mind that is not distracted is not the same as that of the action of the Veda.

original: mtshungs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa kho na'o //
translated: It is exactly the same.

original: des rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa dag tshad ma ma yin par mtshungs pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa dag tshad ma ma yin par mtshungs pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, he thinks that the Veda and non-Veda are exactly the same in not being valid cognitions.

original: 'di la gzhan gyi dogs pa ni //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi dogs pa ni //
translated: Here, the doubt of others is:

original: dam pas brtsi ba min zhe na //
analyzed: dam pas brtsi ba min zhe na //
translated: If you say that the holy ones do not accept it,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: this is what he says.

original: skabs kyis rig byed las gzhan pa'i lung dag la'o //
analyzed: skabs kyis rig byed las gzhan pa'i lung dag la'o //
translated: The holy ones do not accept the scriptures other than the Veda.

original: des na dam pas brtsi ba'i rig byed kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dam pas brtsi ba'i rig byed kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only the Veda accepted by the holy ones is a valid cognition.

original: gal te lung de dag kyang dam pa nyid kyis brtsi ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lung de dag kyang dam pa nyid kyis brtsi ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But aren’t those scriptures also accepted by the holy ones?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: No, that is not so.

original: tshad mar gyur pa'i rig byed la brtsi ba'i bram ze nyid dam pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa'i rig byed la brtsi ba'i bram ze nyid dam pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the highest caste is the Brahmin, who is considered authoritative in the Vedas,

original: lan du de lta yin na phan tshun brten par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: lan du de lta yin na phan tshun brten par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: we reply that in that case, they would be mutually dependent.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: This is clarified in the following:

original: dam pa rig byed don spyod las //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽de'i zhes bya ba rig byed kyi'o //
analyzed: dam pa rig byed don spyod las // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de'i zhes bya ba rig byed kyi'o //
