original: des spyod las zhes bya ba ni dam pas spyod pa las so //
analyzed: des spyod las zhes bya ba ni dam pas spyod pa las so //
translated: The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.

original: 'on te rig byed du gyur pa'i tshad ma las zhes khyad par du byed na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /🔽'on kyang dam pa ni bram ze tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rig byed du gyur pa'i tshad ma las zhes khyad par du byed na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi / 'on kyang dam pa ni bram ze tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.🔽The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.

original: de lta na 'o na bram ze ma yin pa kho na dam pa yin no zhes brjod na /🔽kha yon por mi 'gro'o snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na bram ze ma yin pa kho na dam pa yin no zhes brjod na / kha yon por mi 'gro'o snyam du bsams nas /
translated: The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.

original: dam pas brtsi bar yang mtshungs so zhes ston pa ni /🔽gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam pas brtsi bar yang mtshungs so zhes ston pa ni / gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.🔽The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.🔽The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.

original: rig byed las gzhan pa'i lung ni lung gzhan te /
analyzed: rig byed las gzhan pa'i lung ni lung gzhan te /
translated: The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.🔽The highest caste is from the performance of the meaning of the Vedas.

original: de dang 'brel pa de la mngon bar zhen pa la gang la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa de la mngon bar zhen pa la gang la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Those who are attached to the connection with that are called that.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: mi 'gyur ba ni nyid ce na //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni nyid ce na //
translated: “How is it that it is not changeable?”

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: bram ze'i nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is: “Brahminhood.”

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa bram ze de dag ni sdig la zhes bya ba lta ba gzhan la mi dga' bas so ;
analyzed: bshad pa bram ze de dag ni sdig la zhes bya ba lta ba gzhan la mi dga' bas so ;
translated: It is explained: “Those Brahmins are sinful,” because they do not like other views.

original: / lan du sdig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / lan du sdig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is: “Sinful,” etc.

original: 'di ni sdig pa'i lta ba yin la 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes nges pa la tshad ma ni 'ga' yang med de //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa'i lta ba yin la 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes nges pa la tshad ma ni 'ga' yang med de //
translated: There is no valid cognition whatsoever that ascertains, “This is a sinful view, but that is not.”

original: de nyid kyi don du dpyod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don du dpyod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages in analysis for that very purpose.

original: lta ba nyid sdig pa ma yin mod gang las lung gzhan la yang bram ze brtsi bar 'gyur ba lta ba gzhan la 'jug na skyes bu nyid sdig pa yin pa'i phyir bram ze yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba nyid sdig pa ma yin mod gang las lung gzhan la yang bram ze brtsi bar 'gyur ba lta ba gzhan la 'jug na skyes bu nyid sdig pa yin pa'i phyir bram ze yin no zhe na /
translated: “Even though the view itself is not sinful, if one engages in another view from which another scripture is calculated, then because the person is sinful, he is a Brahmin.”

original: 'dir yang gal te lta ba'i skyon gyis sdig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'dir yang gal te lta ba'i skyon gyis sdig pa ma yin na /
translated: Here, if the sin is not due to the fault of the view,

original: de'i bram ze ma yin pa'i nyes pas sdig pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i bram ze ma yin pa'i nyes pas sdig pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas /
translated: then it is due to the fault of not being a Brahmin.🔽Thus, it would be a case of mutual dependence.

original: slar phan tshun bsten par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /🔽bram ze min @235a * //🔽pas sdig bdag nyid //
analyzed: slar phan tshun bsten par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni / bram ze min @235a * // pas sdig bdag nyid //
translated: To show this, it says:🔽The sin is not due to not being a Brahmin.

original: sdig bdag yin phyir bram ze min //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdig bdag yin phyir bram ze min // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sin is due to not being a Brahmin.

original: de ltar re zhig ma dpyad na dga' ba'i bram ze nyid khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ma dpyad na dga' ba'i bram ze nyid khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa brjod do //
translated: Thus, first, without analysis, he states the refutation, accepting the Brahmin’s pleasure.

original: da ni gang las sus 'gog ces brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gang las sus 'gog ces brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, to say “By whom is it stopped?”🔽is stated in the lines beginning:

original: gang zhig rang gi ngo bo yis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi ngo bo yis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is not by its own nature.

original: de'i rang bzhin las ma reg pa'i rig pas kyang gal te rig pa ma yin na ni thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin las ma reg pa'i rig pas kyang gal te rig pa ma yin na ni thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if it is not known by the cognition that does not touch its nature, then everything would know everything.

original: de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa kho na de rig pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa kho na de rig pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: To explain that it is known only by the one that actualizes its nature, it says:

original: rang gi ngo bo med pa la //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pa la //
translated: And they are devoid of their own entity.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the absence of an intrinsic nature,

original: de dag dam pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag dam pa yin pas /
translated: Here, since they are the best,🔽the Brahmins are the ones who count.🔽But when they are analyzed, the Vedas are not valid knowledge.

original: de dag gis brtsis pa'i rig byed tshad mar 'gyur ba bram ze de nyid rnam par dpyod na mi gnas so zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis brtsis pa'i rig byed tshad mar 'gyur ba bram ze de nyid rnam par dpyod na mi gnas so zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is shown by the word “also.”

original: bram ze la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “etc.” in “Brahmins, etc.” includes the Kshatriyas, etc.

original: bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Action” refers to desire, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bram zer sgrub pa'i 'du byed pa sgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bram zer sgrub pa'i 'du byed pa sgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the performance of the rites that establish one as a Brahmin, etc.

original: 'grel pa nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'du byed las rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'grel pa nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'du byed las rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The commentary says, “endowed with a special ability.” This should be understood to refer to the performance of the rites.

original: rigs nges pa dang bral ba'i legs par byed pa 'ang med pa nyid ces 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs nges pa dang bral ba'i legs par byed pa 'ang med pa nyid ces 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it will be explained that “there is no good karma for those who are not of a definite lineage.”

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gang zhig bram ze yin par mngon par 'dod pa de nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gang zhig bram ze yin par mngon par 'dod pa de nyid do //
translated: “That very” refers to the one who is considered to be a Brahmin.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni //
translated: This is clarified

original: khu yu la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khu yu la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by “the words ‘kū” and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “For this very reason” is the opponent’s.

original: lan ni mngon sum don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni mngon sum don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is “Direct perception is for the sake of the object” and so on.

original: ci'i phyir nye bar bstan pa tshad mar mi rung zhe na /🔽nye bar bstan pa 'jig rten na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nye bar bstan pa tshad mar mi rung zhe na / nye bar bstan pa 'jig rten na //
translated: Why is it that the teaching is not a valid means of knowledge?

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “The teaching in the world . . .”

original: gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ni don dam par yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ni don dam par yang ngo //
translated: “Also” means also ultimately.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: “If . . .” and so on is the commentary.

original: de lta yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi nye bar bstan pa chen po yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi nye bar bstan pa chen po yin na /
translated: “If that is so” means if the teaching of others is great,

original: de'i tshe nye bar bstan pa las the tshom du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe nye bar bstan pa las the tshom du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: then at that time, “from the teaching, doubt” and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “For this very reason” is the opponent’s.

original: nye bar bstan pa mngon sum la ltos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa mngon sum la ltos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The teaching relies on direct perception” is what is meant.

original: sngar ni mngon sum gtso bo yin la nye bar bstan pa ni grogs @235b yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni mngon sum gtso bo yin la nye bar bstan pa ni grogs @235b yin no //
translated: Previously, direct perception was primary and the teaching was secondary.

original: da lte ni bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: da lte ni bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Now, it is the opposite.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “If. . . .”

original: gal te nye bar bstan pa la mi ltos par mngon sum bram ze la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don sgrub par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar bstan pa la mi ltos par mngon sum bram ze la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don sgrub par byed pa yin na /
translated: If direct perception establishes the meaning of the definition of a brahmin, etc., without relying on the teaching,

original: de'i tshe nye bar bstan pa bden pa nyid du sgrub par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nye bar bstan pa bden pa nyid du sgrub par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time it would be possible to establish the truth of the teaching.

original: de lta min na min zhes bya ba ni gal te ma ltos par don sgrub mi nus na de'i tshe nye bar bstan pa bden pa nyid du sgrub pa yang mi nus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta min na min zhes bya ba ni gal te ma ltos par don sgrub mi nus na de'i tshe nye bar bstan pa bden pa nyid du sgrub pa yang mi nus pa kho na'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is not possible. If it is not possible to establish the meaning without relying on the teaching, then at that time it is not possible to establish the truth of the teaching.

original: gzhan du min zhes bya ba 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du min zhes bya ba 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The explanation of “not otherwise” is:

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “If. . . ” and so on.

original: de 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni nus pa med pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni nus pa med pa nyid do ;
translated: “Like that” means it is not possible.

analyzed: myong ba med par zhugs pas so //
translated: who is ignorant of the experience.

original: gal te sngar rigs la nyams su myong ba zhugs na 'o na de nyid la rigs nges la rag mod yu bu la sogs pas ci bya zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te sngar rigs la nyams su myong ba zhugs na 'o na de nyid la rigs nges la rag mod yu bu la sogs pas ci bya zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: If one is ignorant of the experience of the family previously, then the family is ascertained just from that. What is the use of the son, etc.?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de'i phyir nye bar bstan pa ni mngon sum gcig pu skyabs su gyur par grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar bstan pa ni mngon sum gcig pu skyabs su gyur par grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the teaching is the sole refuge.

original: mngon sum ni nam yang rigs la zhugs pa med kyi 'on kyang rus dang bya ba la sogs pa kho na la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni nam yang rigs la zhugs pa med kyi 'on kyang rus dang bya ba la sogs pa kho na la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Direct perception never engages the family, but rather only caste, occupation, etc.

original: yongs su shes pa ni myong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni myong ba'o //
translated: Experience is the knowledge of the object.

original: gal te bya ba dang 'du byed la sogs @237b pa la mngon sum 'jug par rigs pa yin gyi rus la ni yongs su shes pa tsam nyid du zad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bya ba dang 'du byed la sogs @237b pa la mngon sum 'jug par rigs pa yin gyi rus la ni yongs su shes pa tsam nyid du zad do zhe na /
translated: If it is reasonable to apply the term “direct perception” to action, formation, etc., then it is reasonable to apply the term “mere knowledge” to bones.

original: bden te de nyid kyi phyir yongs su shes pa 'am dmigs pa zhes spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te de nyid kyi phyir yongs su shes pa 'am dmigs pa zhes spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is true, but for that very reason, the term “knowledge” or “apprehension” is used in a general sense.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: rus dang 'du byed la sogs pa de nyid rigs yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rus dang 'du byed la sogs pa de nyid rigs yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That very bones, formation, etc., are reasonable.”

original: des na rigs ni mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na rigs ni mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, he thinks that the reason is established by direct perception.

original: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang 'du byed pa'i cha la ltos nas so //
analyzed: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang 'du byed pa'i cha la ltos nas so //
translated: The reply is: “It has already been answered,” in terms of the aspect of action and the aspect of formation.

original: de la bya ba la ltos nas ni dngos su lan dran par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de la bya ba la ltos nas ni dngos su lan dran par byas pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, the reply is directly recalled in terms of action.

original: 'du byed pa la ltos nas ni de nyid nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed pa la ltos nas ni de nyid nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: In terms of formation, it is merely indicated.

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni bya ba nyid do //
translated: “That very” means action itself.

original: da ni rigs kyi de ma thag tu brjod pa rus kyi phyogs kyi lhag ma bkod nas sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rigs kyi de ma thag tu brjod pa rus kyi phyogs kyi lhag ma bkod nas sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: Now, having set forth the remaining part of the clan argument, he refutes it.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ But if they are of the same clan” and so on.

original: gzhan gyi ha cang thal ba'i lan dogs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ha cang thal ba'i lan dogs pa ni /
translated: Fearing the opponent’s reductio, he says,

original: bar du rigs tha dad ce na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bar du rigs tha dad ce na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But if they are of different clans in the interim.”

original: lan ni rgyu mtshan med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rgyu mtshan med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “There is no reason.”

original: gzhan rgyu mtshan med pa'i lan ni bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rgyu mtshan med pa'i lan ni bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent’s response to that is “But if there is no reason in the interim” and so on.

original: bya ba tha dad phyir zhes bya ba ni spyod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba tha dad phyir zhes bya ba ni spyod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Because their activities are different” means because their conduct is different.

original: lan du rus kyi zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: lan du rus kyi zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The answer is “But if they are of the same clan” because they have the same characteristics of being born from Brahma.

original: gal te tshangs pa'i lus gcig las byung na de'i tshe rigs kyis dbye ba med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tshangs pa'i lus gcig las byung na de'i tshe rigs kyis dbye ba med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If they are born from the body of one Brahma, then they would not be divided by clan.

original: gang gi tshe 'od srungs la sogs pa'i rus dag tha dad pa thog ma med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'od srungs la sogs pa'i rus dag tha dad pa thog ma med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the clans of Kasyapa and so on are different, they are beginningless.

original: de'i dbye ba nyid las rigs tha dad pa grub na rigs kyi dbye ba tha dad pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhes bsams nas gzhan dag smra ba ni /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba nyid las rigs tha dad pa grub na rigs kyi dbye ba tha dad pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhes bsams nas gzhan dag smra ba ni /
translated: If the different types of beings are established from the differences in their types, then how could there be no difference in the types of beings?

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others think this and say, “Well then,

original: lan du tshad ma 'jug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //🔽ci bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa 'di rus tha dad pa kho na las sam /
analyzed: lan du tshad ma 'jug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // ci bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa 'di rus tha dad pa kho na las sam /
translated: ” in response, “because there is no engagement of valid cognition.”🔽Is there no valid cognition for this question: “Are the different types of beings, such as brahmins, etc.,

original: 'on te bya ba sna tshogs pa las zhes 'di la tshad ma med do //
analyzed: 'on te bya ba sna tshogs pa las zhes 'di la tshad ma med do //
translated: due only to differences in their bones or due to their various activities?”

original: 'on te mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya ba brgyud pa mthong ba'i phyir thog ma med pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya ba brgyud pa mthong ba'i phyir thog ma med pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that because the continuity of activities such as sacrifice, etc., is seen, they are beginningless,

original: lan du / de ni yongs su ma shes phyir //🔽bya ba bya min nyid du thal //
analyzed: lan du / de ni yongs su ma shes phyir // bya ba bya min nyid du thal //
translated: in response, “Because that is not fully understood,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: it follows that activity is not activity.”🔽Because the characteristics of the beginningless are not fully understood,

original: thog ma med pa'i mtshan nyid can rus yongs su shes pa med pa'i @238a * //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i mtshan nyid can rus yongs su shes pa med pa'i @238a * //
translated: the bones are not fully understood.

original: phyir ro ; / bya min nyid ni dman pa ste //
analyzed: phyir ro ; / bya min nyid ni dman pa ste //
translated: “Not activity” means inferior.

original: bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yan lag tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yan lag tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: The terms brahmin, etc., would not be limbs of convention,

original: tshad ma med pas the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pas the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of doubt due to the absence of a valid means of knowledge.

original: de ltar re zhig rnam par ma chad pa nyid glang po che'i lta stangs kyis btang snyoms su bzhag nas bya ba dang thog ma med pa nyid la the tshom za bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rnam par ma chad pa nyid glang po che'i lta stangs kyis btang snyoms su bzhag nas bya ba dang thog ma med pa nyid la the tshom za bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having first set aside the non-division by the elephant-gazing, he expresses doubt about the beginninglessness.

original: da ni ma chad pa yang shes par mi nus so zhes ston pa ni rus ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni ma chad pa yang shes par mi nus so zhes ston pa ni rus ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to show that even non-division is not possible to know, he says, “bone, etc.”

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni //🔽rus kyi dngos po 'gal yang ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni // rus kyi dngos po 'gal yang ni //
translated: This is clarified:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The bone substance is also contradictory.”

original: bram ze mo dang rgyal rigs las skyes pa ni su ta'o //🔽bram ze mo dang rje'u rigs las skyes pa ni ma rka ta zhes bya ba ste gting rings so //
analyzed: bram ze mo dang rgyal rigs las skyes pa ni su ta'o // bram ze mo dang rje'u rigs las skyes pa ni ma rka ta zhes bya ba ste gting rings so //
translated: Born from a brahmin woman and a kṣatriya is a sūta.🔽Born from a brahmin woman and a vaiśya is a māgadha, which means “deep-voiced.”

original: bram ze mo dang dmangs rigs las skyes pa ni gtum po zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gtsug lag go //
analyzed: bram ze mo dang dmangs rigs las skyes pa ni gtum po zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gtsug lag go //
translated: Born from a brahmin woman and a śūdra is a caṇḍāla, which means “fierce.” These are their scriptures.

original: des na rnam par ma chad par ni ma nges pa kho na'o //🔽de la gang du 'khrul par nges pa de nyid du su ta la sogs par bzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: des na rnam par ma chad par ni ma nges pa kho na'o // de la gang du 'khrul par nges pa de nyid du su ta la sogs par bzhag pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not at all certain that they are not divided.🔽In those places where it is certain that there is confusion, the term “brāhmaṇa” is used.

original: gang du shin tu sbas pas 'khrul pa yod kyang mi shes pa der ni bram ze'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: gang du shin tu sbas pas 'khrul pa yod kyang mi shes pa der ni bram ze'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: In those places where there is confusion due to concealment, but it is not known, the term “brāhmaṇa” is used.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: “ Those” refers to confusion.

original: de shes pas zhes bya ba ni de shes pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de shes pas zhes bya ba ni de shes pa la 'bad pa dang ldan pa dag gis so //
translated: “ By knowing that” means by those who are diligent in knowing that.🔽Moreover, if the caste of brāhmaṇa is established for the purpose of establishing the meaning of the term, this is a great confusion.

original: gzhan yang bram ze'i rigs grub pa'i don du rus nye bar bkod pa yin na 'di nyid ni 'khrul pa chen po yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang bram ze'i rigs grub pa'i don du rus nye bar bkod pa yin na 'di nyid ni 'khrul pa chen po yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show this, he says:

original: dang po bram ze gnas gyur na //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po bram ze gnas gyur na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: First, the brāhmaṇa caste arose.

original: de'i rus ni bram ze'i rus so //
analyzed: de'i rus ni bram ze'i rus so //
translated: His caste is the brāhmaṇa caste.

original: bram ze'i rus ni bram ze brgyud pa las skyes pa yin na mi gnas na ci ltar rus yin /
analyzed: bram ze'i rus ni bram ze brgyud pa las skyes pa yin na mi gnas na ci ltar rus yin /
translated: If the brāhmaṇa caste is born from the brāhmaṇa lineage, how can it be a caste if it does not exist?

original: des na bram ze nyid nges na de'i rigs nges la /
analyzed: des na bram ze nyid nges na de'i rigs nges la /
translated: Therefore, if brāhmaṇa-ness is ascertained, its caste is ascertained.

original: de'i rus nges na yang bram ze nyid nges pa phan tshun brten pa 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rus nges na yang bram ze nyid nges pa phan tshun brten pa 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: If you determine the caste by the bones, then the caste is determined by the bones, and the two are mutually dependent.

original: 'di ni dmus long brgyud pa nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni dmus long brgyud pa nyid //
translated: This is like a succession of blind men.

original: ces bya ba ni bzhad gad du byed pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bzhad gad du byed pa ste /
translated: This is a joke.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir na tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyis 'di ni bram ze'i rigs 'di ni bram ze'i rigs zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di ni dmus long kho na ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir na tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyis 'di ni bram ze'i rigs 'di ni bram ze'i rigs zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di ni dmus long kho na ste /
translated: Because the characteristics of the castes do not endure, those who make conventions say, “This is a Brahmin caste, this is a non-Brahmin caste.” This convention is like a succession of blind men,

original: nges pa'i mig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i mig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no definite eye.

original: da ni sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa nus pa'i phyogs bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: da ni sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa nus pa'i phyogs bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: Now, having presented the position of the opponent that includes the word “etc.,” the refutation is as follows.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: If you say, “It is not so,” and so on.

original: @238b 'ga' la'ang zhes bya ba ni bram ze la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: @238b 'ga' la'ang zhes bya ba ni bram ze la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “Anyone” means a Brahmin and so on.

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smos so //
translated: The opponent says, “If you say, ‘It is not so.’”

original: lan du kun la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan du kun la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In response, “It is not so” means:

original: sngon gyi dus su bram ze dang / bram ze ma yin pa gnyis la thos pa'i phyir brjod pa don med do //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus su bram ze dang / bram ze ma yin pa gnyis la thos pa'i phyir brjod pa don med do //
translated: It is meaningless to say that in former times both Brahmins and non-Brahmins studied.

original: thams cad du song ba'i khyad par gsal bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba'i khyad par gsal bar bya ba ni /
translated: The distinction of being all-pervading is clarified:

original: lung kun las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung kun las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In all the scriptures, etc.

original: 'o na phra ba dang rgyang ring po la sogs pa bzhin du rig byed kho nas bram ze rtog par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na phra ba dang rgyang ring po la sogs pa bzhin du rig byed kho nas bram ze rtog par byed do zhe na /
translated: But just as one infers the existence of the subtle, distant, etc., by means of the Vedas, so one infers the existence of the Brahmin.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gsal ba la ci ma tha ra 'di bram ze yin nam /
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gsal ba la ci ma tha ra 'di bram ze yin nam /
translated: The author replies:

original: 'on te ma yin zhes the tshom zos pa na 'di la ni rig byed ni sgrub byed ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes the tshom zos pa na 'di la ni rig byed ni sgrub byed ma yin no //
translated: When one doubts whether this Brahmin is a Brahmin or not, the Vedas are not a proof.

original: bram ze gsad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni nye bar mi mkho ba nyid do //
analyzed: bram ze gsad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni nye bar mi mkho ba nyid do //
translated: The statement, “One should not kill a Brahmin,” is useless.

original: de la gsal ba'i phyogs bsam par mi rig pa'i phyir 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsal ba'i phyogs bsam par mi rig pa'i phyir 'grel pa ni /
translated: Since the Brahmin is not known to exist in the present, the commentary explains:

original: rig byed du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: rig byed du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: In the Vedas, etc.🔽Because they are not always, etc.

original: / thams cad kyi tshe med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni koo ti la sogs pa'i gsal bar mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / thams cad kyi tshe med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni koo ti la sogs pa'i gsal bar mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The author of the commentary explains that the Vedas are not always, because the Brahmins, etc., are impermanent.

original: gal te rig byed kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid yin na ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid yin na ci skyon zhe na /
translated: If the Veda is like that, what is the fault?

original: rig byed ni rtag pas gtan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed ni rtag pas gtan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Veda is eternal, it exists forever.

original: gal te rtag pas mi rtag pa'i brjod na ci 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pas mi rtag pa'i brjod na ci 'gal zhe na /
translated: If it is eternal, what is the contradiction in saying that it is not eternal?

original: don med pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don med pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is meaningless at a time when it does not exist.

original: don dang ldan pa nyams pa nyid gsal ba yin na ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa nyams pa nyid gsal ba yin na ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it is meaningful, it is clear that it is destroyed.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni /
translated: Another says:

original: gang gi tshe don 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de ltar rig byed don dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de ltar rig byed don dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: When the meaning occurs, at that time the Veda becomes meaningful.

original: 'di la lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The reply to this is:

original: don med pa'i rig byad ces bya ba la'o //
analyzed: don med pa'i rig byad ces bya ba la'o //
translated: The Veda is meaningless.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i don la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung ba'i don la'o //
translated: The meaning that occurs later is in regard to that.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba ni bya ba yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba ni bya ba yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The distinction is the characteristic of the existence and nonexistence of activity.

original: de'i rang bzhin bya ba ni don yod pa dang / med pa'i dus na rig byed khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin bya ba ni don yod pa dang / med pa'i dus na rig byed khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The nature of that is that at the time of the existence or non-existence of the object, the nature of the indicative is not different.

original: de'i tshe rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: At that time, there is a distinction.

original: don dang ldan pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di rig byed pa rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di rig byed pa rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: One will understand the indicative to have the characteristic of being meaningful.

original: de'i phyir rig byed kyi nye bar bstan pa ni don dang ldan pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed kyi nye bar bstan pa ni don dang ldan pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the indicative is not meaningless. This is the intended meaning.

original: des na rig byed kyi tshig ni gsal ba bram ze sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rig byed kyi tshig ni gsal ba bram ze sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the words of the indicative do not establish the brahmin.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //🔽gnyi ga @239a * //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o // gnyi ga @239a * //
translated: Thus, etc. is the conclusion.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang nye bar bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang nye bar bstan pa dag go //
translated: Both refers to direct perception and teaching.

original: des zhes bya ba ni bram ze la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni bram ze la sogs pa'o //
translated: By that refers to the brahmin, etc.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par bram ze ma grub pa'i rgyu des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par bram ze ma grub pa'i rgyu des na'o //
translated: Because the ultimate non-establishment of the brahmin is the reason, therefore.

original: gal te tha snyad du grub pa'i bram ze rig byed kyi don bya ba'i tshul byed pa yin pa des na tha snyad la mi slu ba'i phyir rig byed tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas spong ba ni /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad du grub pa'i bram ze rig byed kyi don bya ba'i tshul byed pa yin pa des na tha snyad la mi slu ba'i phyir rig byed tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas spong ba ni /
translated: This is refuted by way of a conclusion:🔽Therefore, not only is the Brahmin not established, but the Brahmin is not established conventionally.🔽The his refers to the Brahmin.🔽Since the Veda is not valid in that way, it is not examined and is not ascertained by valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir bram ze ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi bram ze la yang tha snyad du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bram ze ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi bram ze la yang tha snyad du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Having thus refuted the Veda as the Dharma of the Brahmin and the Dharma of the person who is born from the ritual of impregnation,🔽having presented the Veda as the Dharma of the one who is engaged in the ritual of impregnation, the refutation is:🔽If it is argued that the Veda is valid because it is the means of accomplishing the purpose of the Brahmin who exists conventionally, then the Veda is not valid because it is non-deceptive with respect to the conventional.🔽This is refuted by way of a conclusion:🔽Therefore, not only is the Brahmin not established, but the Brahmin is not established conventionally.

original: 'ga' zhig gi la zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i 'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi la zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i 'o //
translated: The his refers to the Brahmin.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rig byed tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de yongs su ma brtags pa tshad mas ma nges pa'i rig byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rig byed tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de yongs su ma brtags pa tshad mas ma nges pa'i rig byed do //
translated: Since the Veda is not valid in that way, it is not examined and is not ascertained by valid cognition.

original: de ltar nges sbyor skyes bu dang / mchod sbyin dag gi chos yin pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar nges sbyor skyes bu dang / mchod sbyin dag gi chos yin pa bsal nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the Veda as the Dharma of the Brahmin and the Dharma of the person who is born from the ritual of impregnation,🔽having presented the Veda as the Dharma of the one who is engaged in the ritual of impregnation, the refutation is:

original: nges sbyor nges par sbyor bar byed pa'i chos yin pa bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: nges sbyor nges par sbyor bar byed pa'i chos yin pa bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: If it is argued that the Veda is valid because it is the means of accomplishing the purpose of the Brahmin who exists conventionally, then the Veda is not valid because it is non-deceptive with respect to the conventional.🔽This is refuted by way of a conclusion:🔽Therefore, not only is the Brahmin not established, but the Brahmin is not established conventionally.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The his refers to the Brahmin.🔽Since the Veda is not valid in that way, it is not examined and is not ascertained by valid cognition.🔽Having thus refuted the Veda as the Dharma of the Brahmin and the Dharma of the person who is born from the ritual of impregnation,🔽having presented the Veda as the Dharma of the one who is engaged in the ritual of impregnation, the refutation is:🔽If it is argued that the Veda is valid because it is the means of accomplishing the purpose of the Brahmin who exists

original: nges sbyor byed pa po ni rig byed do //
analyzed: nges sbyor byed pa po ni rig byed do //
translated: The one who definitely joins is the Veda.

original: yang rtag pa'i phyir khyad par du byar med pa ma yin pas de'i chos kyang rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rtag pa'i phyir khyad par du byar med pa ma yin pas de'i chos kyang rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is permanent, it is not without distinction, so its property is also permanent.

original: de lta yin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa sgrub na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa sgrub na'o //
translated: If it is so, that is, if the Veda is permanent, then the property of the Veda is also permanent.🔽If you prove that, then valid cognition would be pointless.

original: tshad ma don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rig byed ni nges par sbyor ba rtogs par byed pa'i sgo nas mngon par 'dod pa'i sgrub byed la skyes bu 'jug par byed pas tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rig byed ni nges par sbyor ba rtogs par byed pa'i sgo nas mngon par 'dod pa'i sgrub byed la skyes bu 'jug par byed pas tshad ma yin no //
translated: The Veda is valid cognition because it causes a person to engage in the desired goal by making known the definite joining.

original: gal te rang gi lus nyid la rig byed kyi rjes su sgrub pa gzhan dang gzhan rgyun mi 'chad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi lus nyid la rig byed kyi rjes su sgrub pa gzhan dang gzhan rgyun mi 'chad pa yin na /
translated: If the performance of one Vedic injunction after another is uninterrupted in one's own body,

original: de'i tshe phyi rol la 'jug pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir tshad mar khas blangs pa don med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyi rol la 'jug pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir tshad mar khas blangs pa don med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: then it would be pointless to accept it as valid cognition because it would not engage with external objects.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag 'jug par byed pa nyid du sgrub pas rig byed don dang ldan pa nyid kyis tshad mar gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag 'jug par byed pa nyid du sgrub pas rig byed don dang ldan pa nyid kyis tshad mar gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase or else... and so on, proves that the Vedas are the means of valid knowledge because they are meaningful, and that they are authoritative because they are the means of valid knowledge.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: nges par sbyor bar byed pa po'i chos yin yang /
analyzed: nges par sbyor bar byed pa po'i chos yin yang /
translated: Even though the Vedas are the property of one who is engaged in them,🔽if they were to be just that nature without depending on something else,

original: gal te gzhan la mi ltos par de tsam gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe /🔽gal te grub kyang bsgrub bya na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la mi ltos par de tsam gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe / gal te grub kyang bsgrub bya na //
translated: then at that time,

original: zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: the fault would arise that even though they are established, they are still the probandum.

original: 'on kyang nges par sbyar bya dang yul la ltos na /
analyzed: 'on kyang nges par sbyar bya dang yul la ltos na /
translated: However, if one depends on the object of engagement and the object,

original: nges par sbyor ba de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then just that kind of engagement is possible.

original: nges par sbyar bya dang yul la ltos @239b pa nyid ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: nges par sbyar bya dang yul la ltos @239b pa nyid ston par byed pa ni /
translated: To show that very dependence on the object of engagement and the object,

original: nges par sbyar bya dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par sbyar bya dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it says, devoid of the object of engagement..., and so on.

original: 'thad pa brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'thad pa brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The logical justification is stated with the phrase because..., and so on.

original: 'di'i yul 'di la zhes bya bas ni byed pa po dang 'brel pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di'i yul 'di la zhes bya bas ni byed pa po dang 'brel pa'i phyir na /
translated: Here, the phrase in regard to this object indicates that the agent is related to the object.

original: bla lhag tu gyur par de gnyis la ltos pa bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bla lhag tu gyur par de gnyis la ltos pa bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the two are dependent in a reciprocal manner.

original: yang ji ltar gnyi ga la gdon mi za bar ltos dgos she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gnyi ga la gdon mi za bar ltos dgos she na /
translated: Moreover, why is it that both must be dependent in a reciprocal manner?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, “because of the reason . . .”

original: yul med na skul byed du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul med na skul byed du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if there is no object, it is not tenable that there is an agent.

original: de nyid kyi nges par sbyar bya nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i mtho ris 'dod pa yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi nges par sbyar bya nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i mtho ris 'dod pa yang /
translated: Moreover, the one who is desirous of heaven, who is certainly desirous of the object,

original: gdon mi za bar bdag nyid nges par sbyar bya nyid du rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bdag nyid nges par sbyar bya nyid du rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: will certainly understand that he himself is the one who is to be instigated.

original: bskul bya med na yang bskul ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bskul bya med na yang bskul ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if there is no one to be instigated, then it is not tenable that there is instigation.

original: de ltar gsum po rnams kyi phan tshun ltos pa'i mtshan nyid 'brel pa yin mod /
analyzed: de ltar gsum po rnams kyi phan tshun ltos pa'i mtshan nyid 'brel pa yin mod /
translated: Thus, the three are certainly related to one another in the sense that they are dependent in a reciprocal manner.

original: grub pa'i phyir rjes su bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dir 'di lan du ci ltar che snyam na /
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir rjes su bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dir 'di lan du ci ltar che snyam na /
translated: But how does this response apply to the present case?

original: de lta bu'i nges pa sbyor ba de yang smos so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nges pa sbyor ba de yang smos so //
translated: The application of such a principle is also mentioned.

original: gsum po rnams kyi phan tshun ltos pas gzhag go //
analyzed: gsum po rnams kyi phan tshun ltos pas gzhag go //
translated: The three are posited in mutual dependence.

original: gal te 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa yin na /
translated: If they are related,🔽then how does one engage in the proof of the probandum?

original: 'o na gang zhig gal te ltos bya bsgrub par bya ba la yang skyes bu 'jug / ci ltar 'phen ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig gal te ltos bya bsgrub par bya ba la yang skyes bu 'jug / ci ltar 'phen ce na /
translated: How does one impel?

original: rang gi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “One’s own action,” and so on.

original: des na 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it impels, it is a valid cognition.

original: sun 'byin par byed pas 'khrul pa dang the tshom za ba dag kyang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug par byed pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pas 'khrul pa dang the tshom za ba dag kyang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug par byed pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: But since it follows that one would engage in refutation and doubt, mere engagement is not a valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs par byed pa las yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs par byed pa las yin na /
translated: But if it is a valid cognition because it causes one to understand the nature of things,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: then that is not the case.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: khams kyi don ni bya ba ste /
analyzed: khams kyi don ni bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the elements is action,

original: mchod sbyin byed pa la sogs pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin byed pa la sogs pa'i yul can no //
translated: the object of the agent of sacrifice, etc.

original: nges par sbyor ba ni nges par sbyor bzhin pa'i skyes bu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba ni nges par sbyor bzhin pa'i skyes bu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The definite description is the nature of the person who is in the process of being described.

original: sgom byed ni skul bar byed pa po sgra'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgom byed ni skul bar byed pa po sgra'i byed pa'o //
translated: The cultivation is the function of the word that impels.

original: de dag gis phan tshun 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni rig byed kyi sa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid nges sbyor smra ba rnams kyang nges sbyor du rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro @240a * //
analyzed: de dag gis phan tshun 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni rig byed kyi sa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid nges sbyor smra ba rnams kyang nges sbyor du rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro @240a * //
translated: The relation of mutual connection by those is the relation that is to be established by the science of grammar. Thus, even the proponents of the definite description are established in the definite description.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At the time of understanding means at the time of understanding the meaning of the sentence.

original: med pas zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can gyi yul gcig med kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pas zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can gyi yul gcig med kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence means because of the absence of a single related object.

original: de'i 'brel pa ni nges sbyor du khas mi len gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa ni nges sbyor du khas mi len gyi /
translated: The relation of that is not accepted as a definite description, but rather as a relation of mutual connection.

original: 'on kyang rang grub par bya ba'i don du nges par sbyor bar byed pa'i don gzhan kho na zhig nges sbyor du smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang grub par bya ba'i don du nges par sbyor bar byed pa'i don gzhan kho na zhig nges sbyor du smra ba'o //
translated: However, it is only another object that is definitely applied for the sake of establishing itself that is said to be definitely applied.

original: 'brel pa nges sbyor yin no zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis nye bar btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: 'brel pa nges sbyor yin no zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis nye bar btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do snyam du dogs na /
translated: As for the statement the relation is the definite application, we think that this is merely a designation by you.

original: khams kyi don la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: khams kyi don la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says the meaning of the elements, etc.

original: 'o na khams kyi don la sogs pa gnas pa'i 'brel pa nyid don yin par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'o na khams kyi don la sogs pa gnas pa'i 'brel pa nyid don yin par 'gyur mod /
translated: Well, if the relation of abiding is the meaning, then the meaning of the elements, etc. would be the relation itself.

original: de ci'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would that be the non-apprehension?

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To this he says gradually, etc.

original: sgra byed pas ni skyes bu'i byed pa skyed /
analyzed: sgra byed pas ni skyes bu'i byed pa skyed /
translated: The sound-maker generates the human activity.

original: skyes bu byed pas ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pas ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir na /
translated: The human activity generates the sacrifice, etc.

original: rim pa dang ldan pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa sgra'i byed pa la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i 'brel pa snang ba ga la yod /
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa sgra'i byed pa la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i 'brel pa snang ba ga la yod /
translated: How can there be an appearance of a relation that is not understood, such as the sound-maker, etc., which have the nature of cause and effect in a sequential order?

original: sngar ni 'brel pa can gcig med pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni 'brel pa can gcig med pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa yin la /
translated: Previously, it was said that the reason is because one related object does not exist.

original: da ltar ni 'brel pa can thams cad yod kyang zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: da ltar ni 'brel pa can thams cad yod kyang zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: Now, the difference is that even though all related objects exist.

original: gal te 'brel pa can gcig med kyang 'brel pa med pa rang gi ngo bo snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa can gcig med kyang 'brel pa med pa rang gi ngo bo snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If one related object does not exist, would not the unrelated object appear in its own nature?

original: des na ci ltar 'brel pa ngag gi don yin na dmigs pa med par thal bar 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'brel pa ngag gi don yin na dmigs pa med par thal bar 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that if the relation is the meaning of the word, the consequence is that there is no object?

original: rang gi ngo bor snang ba ni yod pa'i yul can snang ba'i phyir dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor snang ba ni yod pa'i yul can snang ba'i phyir dang zhes smos so //
translated: In response to this doubt, it is said that the appearance in its own nature is the appearance of the object that exists.

original: de lta na ni 'o na 'brel pa nyid 'brel can gyi rang bzhin du snang ba yin no zhes dogs na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na 'brel pa nyid 'brel can gyi rang bzhin du snang ba yin no zhes dogs na /
translated: In that case, the relation itself appears in the nature of the related object.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes smos te /🔽'brel pa can gyi ngo bor snang ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes smos te / 'brel pa can gyi ngo bor snang ba ni /
translated: In response to this doubt, it is said that the appearance in the nature of another is🔽the appearance in the nature of the related object.

original: 'brel pa de snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa de snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the appearance of that relation.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said that another is the other, etc.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o ;
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o ;
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be too broad.

original: / de lta yin dang lhag par zhen par byas pas med pa'i nges sbyor la ltos nas /
analyzed: / de lta yin dang lhag par zhen par byas pas med pa'i nges sbyor la ltos nas /
translated: If that were the case, then because of the adherence to the nonexistence of the object,

original: rig byed kyi mnyan pa ni dmigs pa med pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mnyan pa ni dmigs pa med pa kho na yin la /
translated: the listener of the Vedas would be one that has no object at all.

original: snang ba la ltos nas ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba la ltos nas ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: But in dependence on appearance, it is one that has an object that is the exclusion of other.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs @240b pa'o ;
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs @240b pa'o ;
translated: The establishment of the nonexistence of the object is as follows.

original: / mchod sbyin la sogs kyis shig ces bya bas ni sgrub pa'i rang bzhin mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rnam pa de ma yin pa las ldog par snang ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po med pa lhag par zhen pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: / mchod sbyin la sogs kyis shig ces bya bas ni sgrub pa'i rang bzhin mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rnam pa de ma yin pa las ldog par snang ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po med pa lhag par zhen pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The words “by means of the sacrifice, etc.” indicate that because the form of the sacrifice, etc., which is the nature of the action, appears as the exclusion of what is not that and because the performer of the sacrifice also comes into existence, the adherence to the nonexistence of the object is taught.

original: des na mnyan par bya ba'i gzhan sel ba'i yul can dang / dmigs med pa zhes sgrub po de bzhin du gzhan sel ba'i yul can gzhan la yang gzhan sel ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na mnyan par bya ba'i gzhan sel ba'i yul can dang / dmigs med pa zhes sgrub po de bzhin du gzhan sel ba'i yul can gzhan la yang gzhan sel ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the subject of the exclusion of other that is to be heard and the subject of the exclusion of other that is established as nonapprehended should be understood in the same way.

original: rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: “At the time of understanding” means at the time of understanding the meaning of the statement.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid do //
translated: “That” refers to the agent.

original: sel ba'i yul can du sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sel ba'i yul can du sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Another way of establishing the subject of the exclusion is explained.

original: sgras ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgras ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “By the word” is the subject.

original: sgras ni rtogs par nus pa yang ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sgras ni rtogs par nus pa yang ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: “By the word” is connected to “it is not possible to understand.”

original: ci zhig ce na sngar ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ce na sngar ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: What? The previously unapprehended.

original: de lta bu'i dngos por zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos por zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In that way” means

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa byed pa rten du nyid du'o ;
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa byed pa rten du nyid du'o ;
translated: as the basis of the agent of the sacrifice and so on.

original: / gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni sngar mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: / gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni sngar mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: “Other” is the previously unapprehended.

original: de ltar byed pa po nyid rtogs mod /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po nyid rtogs mod /
translated: Thus the agent is understood.

original: de lta na yang 'di dmigs pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dmigs pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But in that case, how could it be without an object?

original: sngon gyi rjes su 'brangs nas zhes smos so //
analyzed: sngon gyi rjes su 'brangs nas zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase in accordance with what has gone before is stated.

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can nyid nye bar mtshon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can nyid nye bar mtshon par byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase the subject of the exclusion of other indicates the subject of the universal.

original: dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid do //🔽de lta yin na sngar bya ba dang ldan par mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid do // de lta yin na sngar bya ba dang ldan par mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni /
translated: The phrase the subject of the non-existent indicates the subject of the non-existent.

original: dngos po nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the apprehension of the one who is engaged in activity is direct perception, and it is the apprehension of an entity.

original: de lta ma yin na bya ba dang ldan pa rtogs so zhes ci ltar brjod ces dogs na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bya ba dang ldan pa rtogs so zhes ci ltar brjod ces dogs na /
translated: If it were not so, then how could one say that the one who is engaged in activity is apprehended?

original: mngon sum las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mngon sum las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The phrase from direct perception is stated.

original: bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi byed pa po nyid du rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi byed pa po nyid du rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Not only is there no apprehension of activity, but there is also no apprehension of the agent.

original: ci'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there no apprehension?

original: sngon dang phyi ma las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase from prior and subsequent non-observation is stated.

original: byed pa po ni 'bras bu bsams shing phan 'dogs par byed pa rnams bsogs nas sgrub par byed pa la byed pa po zhes brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po ni 'bras bu bsams shing phan 'dogs par byed pa rnams bsogs nas sgrub par byed pa la byed pa po zhes brjod pa yin la /
translated: The agent is one who, having thought about the result and having accumulated the means of benefitting, is engaged in the accomplishment of that. He is called the agent.

original: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa cha shas dang ldan pa'i bya ba yang skad cig gcig la rdzogs par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa cha shas dang ldan pa'i bya ba yang skad cig gcig la rdzogs par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: And the action that has a part that is prior and a part that is subsequent is not completed in a single moment.

original: mngon sum ni skad cig 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum ni skad cig 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that perception grasps a single moment.

original: 'o na ji ltar bya ba dang ldan par rtogs so zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bya ba dang ldan par rtogs so zhes brjod ce na /
translated: But how can it be understood to have action?

original: tha snyad pa'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “in conventional usage.”

original: @241a * // tha snyad pa'i mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas gcig tu byed pas 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: @241a * // tha snyad pa'i mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas gcig tu byed pas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Conventional perception is engaged in making a unity in dependence on conceptual thought.

original: de la ltos nas kyang bya ba dang ldan par rtogs so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos nas kyang bya ba dang ldan par rtogs so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: And in dependence on that, it is said that it is understood to have action.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In every case” means

original: gal te gzhan gyi lugs kyis byed pa dngos po yin pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi lugs kyis byed pa dngos po yin pa'am /
translated: if action is a thing according to the opponent’s view,

original: yang na rigs pas tha snyad nyid yang rung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rigs pas tha snyad nyid yang rung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or if it is a mere convention according to our view.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “But if” is the opponent’s view.

original: gang gis sbyor bar byed pa nyid yin pas med pa rjod par byed pa'i mnyan pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba byed pa po nyid du bskul bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis sbyor bar byed pa nyid yin pas med pa rjod par byed pa'i mnyan pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba byed pa po nyid du bskul bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Since it is the very one that connects, the listener who expresses the nonexistent would be just the one who is urged to be the agent, but not the one who is connected.

original: byed pa po sbyar bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po sbyar bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The agent is not the one to be connected.

original: mi byed pa por 'gyur ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid yod pa ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi byed pa por 'gyur ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid yod pa ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is not the case that he becomes a nonagent.

original: dbang du bya ba'i mtshan nyid rung ba nyid ni de la yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i mtshan nyid rung ba nyid ni de la yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: The characteristic of being suitable, which is the characteristic of being controlled, exists for him alone.

original: de nyid kyang nges sbyor du smra'o snyam du bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: de nyid kyang nges sbyor du smra'o snyam du bsams pa'o ;
translated: And that very one is said to be connected.

original: / lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: That is not so.

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la rung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i yul 'ga' zhig la rung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is suitable with regard to some object of activity, such as a sacrifice, that is to be accomplished.

original: yul med par ni de 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yul med par ni de 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable without an object.

original: 'on te yul med pa'i phyir rung ba nyid med kyang mchod sbyin gyis zhes brjod pa las rtogs par 'gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te yul med pa'i phyir rung ba nyid med kyang mchod sbyin gyis zhes brjod pa las rtogs par 'gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: But if the object does not exist, then even though the possibility does not exist, it is understood from the expression “by Yajñadatta.”

original: des na mnyan pa dmigs pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na mnyan pa dmigs pa med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /

original: yul ni dbang po las 'das na zhes smos te /
analyzed: yul ni dbang po las 'das na zhes smos te /

original: yul ma rtogs na de'i khyad par can rung ba nyid mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul ma rtogs na de'i khyad par can rung ba nyid mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that if the object is not grasped, then the possibility that it has a particular property is not grasped.

original: des na mnyan la dmigs pa med pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na mnyan la dmigs pa med pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: So the thought is that the hearing is indeed without an object.

original: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni rung ba nyid kyi yul zhes smos te /
analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni rung ba nyid kyi yul zhes smos te /
translated: The second half is explained: “The object of the possibility.”

original: rung ba nyid kyi yul rang gi bya ba can no //
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyi yul rang gi bya ba can no //

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa rang gi bya ba yod pa de ni rang gi bya ba can no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa rang gi bya ba yod pa de ni rang gi bya ba can no //
translated: Yajñadatta, who has his own activity, has his own activity.

original: byed pa po bzhin du rung ba nyid 'dir yang ste /
analyzed: byed pa po bzhin du rung ba nyid 'dir yang ste /
translated: The possibility is just like the agent.

original: ci ltar byed pa po nyid med pa de bzhin du de'i yul gyi khyad par can rung ba nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro //🔽rnam dpyod la ni dpyod rnams te /

original: gnas rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gnas rnams kyis so //
translated: The analysis of the analysis is with respect to the bases.

original: 'di ni bsting chang ngo /
analyzed: 'di ni bsting chang ngo /

analyzed: // / da ni dpyod pa pa gna' ma rnams kyi lugs la brten nas /

analyzed: yang sun dbyung ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa ni / gzhan dag bya ba dag pa @241b yi ;

analyzed: gang gi phyir nges sbyor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
translated: The explanation of this is the three verses beginning with “application.”

original: de la sbyin sreg gis shig ces bya bas ni ling nga'i don dang rang grub pa'i don du skul ba 'phangs pas nges par sbyor ba dang / rjes su bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /

analyzed: des na bya ba dag pa'i rang bzhin nges sbyor yin no //

analyzed: 'di'i 'grel pa ni / gnyis pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: de gnyis las gzhan gang yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan gang yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'o //
translated: The tenth alternative is that the appropriator is other than those two.

original: cha shas gnyis la gnas pa ni gnyi ga ste cha shas dang 'brel pas na gnyis te tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha shas gnyis la gnas pa ni gnyi ga ste cha shas dang 'brel pas na gnyis te tshogs pa'o //
translated: The two parts are both, and since they are related to the parts, they are a collection.

original: gnyi ga 'di la yod pa zhes bya bas tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir bya ba dang bskul ba ni gnyi gar brjod do //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'di la yod pa zhes bya bas tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir bya ba dang bskul ba ni gnyi gar brjod do //
translated: Since both exist in this, it is said to be a collection, and since it is related to the collection, action and instigation are both expressed.

original: de gnyis las gzhan bya ba dang bskul ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nges @242b sbyor gyi sgras brjod par bya ba gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan bya ba dang bskul ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nges @242b sbyor gyi sgras brjod par bya ba gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Apart from those two, the nature of action and instigation is not definite, and what is expressed by the term “conjunction” becomes something else.

original: de nyid 'chad pa ni gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'chad pa ni gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is explained as “because of that” and so on.

original: tshangs pa zhes bya ba gnyis med pa sems pa'i rang bzhin ni man ngag las zhes rig byed las rtogs te /
analyzed: tshangs pa zhes bya ba gnyis med pa sems pa'i rang bzhin ni man ngag las zhes rig byed las rtogs te /
translated: Brahma, which is nondual, is understood from the Veda, which has the nature of injunctions.

original: 'di thams cad ni tshangs pa'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni tshangs pa'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that all this is Brahma.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas na khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas na khyab pa yin no //
translated: One is pervasion, as stated by “everywhere” and so on.

original: grub pa ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa ni gnas pa ste /
translated: Established means abiding.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas na /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas na /

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “permanent” is the meaning of “eternal.”

original: skabs kyis na gang phyir nges sbyor du 'dod ces bya ba yin pa des na grub pa'i phyir de bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyis na gang phyir nges sbyor du 'dod ces bya ba yin pa des na grub pa'i phyir de bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the context is a discussion of the meaning of “eternal,” the meaning of “permanent” is not intended.

original: bya ba nyid ni rang grub pa'i don du skul ba yin te /🔽des na skul pa nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: bya ba nyid ni rang grub pa'i don du skul ba yin te / des na skul pa nyid kyang med do //
translated: The meaning of “to be done” is to be urged to accomplish something that has not yet been accomplished.🔽Therefore, since the meaning of “to be done” is not intended, there is no urging.

original: des na gnyi ga las grol ba'i nges sbyor dag gi don yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga las grol ba'i nges sbyor dag gi don yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “eternal” is free from both.

original: 'khrul 'khor la gnas sogs zhes gang bshad pa de las dang po pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor la gnas sogs zhes gang bshad pa de las dang po pa ston pa ni /

analyzed: de bzhin 'khrul 'khor la gnas pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Likewise, one who is situated in a machine.”

analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni / gang 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is:🔽“Whatever is done by someone who is situated in a machine.”

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni mtho ris la'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni mtho ris la'o //
translated: “Wherever” means in heaven.

original: der zhes bya ba de'i rgyu mtshan gyis te /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba de'i rgyu mtshan gyis te /
translated: “There” means on that basis.

original: sbyin sreg gis shig ces bya ba'i nges sbyor yod na'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gis shig ces bya ba'i nges sbyor yod na'o //
translated: “By means of a sacrifice” is the eternal injunction.

original: yul ni 'dod pa'i yul mtho ris te de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni 'dod pa'i yul mtho ris te de la gnas pa'o //
translated: The object is the object of desire, heaven, and the person is situated there.

original: bdag 'di mchod sbyin pa dang ldan pa na nges par mtho ris thob bo zhes bsams nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag 'di mchod sbyin pa dang ldan pa na nges par mtho ris thob bo zhes bsams nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: When I make this sacrifice, I will certainly attain heaven.

original: de ltar yul dang de la gnas pa longs spyad par bya ba dang / longs spyod par byed pa dag gis 'brel par nges sbyor yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yul dang de la gnas pa longs spyad par bya ba dang / longs spyod par byed pa dag gis 'brel par nges sbyor yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the object, the one who abides there, the one who is to be enjoyed, and the one who enjoys, are definitely connected, i.e., related.🔽Is it the nature of the object to be enjoyed?

original: ci de spyad bya'i rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba gnyis pa 'chad par byed pa ni /
analyzed: ci de spyad bya'i rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba gnyis pa 'chad par byed pa ni /
translated: The second verse explains:🔽The four verses beginning with This is mine show the self's concern.🔽 The verse This is mine, I am the owner shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the enjoyer shows the self's concern.

original: 'di ni nga yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o nga'i zhes bya ba 'di'i lhur bya ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni nga yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o nga'i zhes bya ba 'di'i lhur bya ba ston pa ni /
translated: The verse I am the one who is bound shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is liberated shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be enjoyed shows the self's concern.

original: nga yi zhes ni rnam shes pa //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nga yi zhes ni rnam shes pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse I am the one who is to be known shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be purified shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be released shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be crossed over shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be attained shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be realized shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be seen shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be heard shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be touched shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be reflected upon shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be meditated upon shows the self's concern.🔽 The verse I am the one who is to be worshipped shows the self's concern.

original: me tog gi phreng ba dang tsan dan la sogs pa ltar rung ba tsam gyis ni longs spyad par bya ba mi 'dod kyi longs spyod pa pos zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba dang tsan dan la sogs pa ltar rung ba tsam gyis ni longs spyad par bya ba mi 'dod kyi longs spyod pa pos zin pa nyid do //
translated: The verse I am the one who is to be praised shows the self's concern.

original: de ltar ni 'brel pa nges sbyor yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'brel pa nges sbyor yin la /
translated: The verse I am the one who is

analyzed: 'dir ni de 'dra ba'i longs spyad par bya ba nyid yin pas tha dad do // longs spyod par byed pa de yang longs @243a * //
translated: Here, however, it is different, since it is the object of enjoyment.

original: spyad par bya ba'i bdag po'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yin te /🔽ba lang bzhin du bde ba'i bdag po ni yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: spyad par bya ba'i bdag po'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yin te / ba lang bzhin du bde ba'i bdag po ni yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: And that which enjoys is held to be the nature of the master of the object of enjoyment.🔽It is not the master of pleasure, like a cow.

original: bdag po nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show this, he says, “as the master of the object of enjoyment,” etc.

analyzed: longs spyod par bya ba de 'ang gal te longs spyad pa po'i bsgrub par bya ba yin na /

analyzed: de'i tshe nges sbyor du rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas /

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With this in mind, he says, “whose,” etc.

original: spyir bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin nyid du nye bar mtshon pa'i rang bzhin gang gis de'i zhes rtogs pa de yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: spyir bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin nyid du nye bar mtshon pa'i rang bzhin gang gis de'i zhes rtogs pa de yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: If the nature of the effect in general is indicated, then by what nature is it understood that it is “his”?🔽The rest is self-evident.

original: de'i bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni longs spyod pa po bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de'i bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni longs spyod pa po bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The nature of the object to be accomplished is the nature of the object to be enjoyed by the agent.

original: yang ci'i phyir bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin gyis bdag nyid kyi longs spyad par bya ba nges sbyor yin no zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin gyis bdag nyid kyi longs spyad par bya ba nges sbyor yin no zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it that the object to be enjoyed is determined by the nature of the object to be accomplished?

original: grub pa'i longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, The enjoyment of what is accomplished, etc.

original: de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba grub pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba grub pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyis so //
translated: By that alone means by the nature of the object to be accomplished alone.

analyzed: 'o na ci ltar longs spyad par bya ba nges sbyor yin zhe na / longs spyod bsgrub bya nyid kyis na //
translated: But how is the object to be enjoyed determined?

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: He says, Because the enjoyment is to be accomplished.

analyzed: yang na nges sbyor skyes bu'am bya ba gsum pa bshad pa ni /

analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu'i khyad par can gyi skyes bu nyid do //
